Rose requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery goods to sell like canned goods, coffee, milk, eggs, noodles, spices, etc. In the future, she would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell like canned goods, coffee, milk, eggs, noodles, spices, etc.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 45 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. Carmelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store. 

Carmelita has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns additional income from buying and selling piglets. Carmelita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 67 years old and widowed.  She has twelve children. Gloria is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for 20 years now,

Gloria requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. Gloria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling vegetables and raising livestock. 

Evelyn is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, beer, etc. for her general store business.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, beer, etc.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie works hard to support her family. Rosemarie is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell, like shampoo and groceries.

Rosemarie has been in this business for two years now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 58 years old. She is married with two children. Editha works very hard to provide for them.

Editha runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional goods like canned goods, coffee, milk, diapers, snack foods, cooking oil, etc. to sell. Editha has been in this business for 7 years. 

Editha would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods like canned goods, coffee, milk, diapers, snack foods, cooking oil, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is married with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Elsie is 44 years old and has five children in school.

Elsie has a general store business in the Philippines. Elsie requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like spices, rice, milk, soft drinks, etc. Elsie has been in this business for 2 years. 

In the future, Elsie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like spices, rice, milk, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Mateo

texts.es:
Mateo, reconoce que con los créditos tiene mejores ingresos es por eso que nuevamente está solicitando un crédito, que será el complemento para comprar una vaca parida e insumos para alimentarla. El capital anterior fue bien invertido le ayudo a seguir trabajando y evito deshacerse del ganado que ya tenía.
 Para él es satisfactorio saber que hoy su familia ya tiene mejores condiciones de vida, están saludables.
texts.en:
Mateo recognizes that with the help of the loans he has a better income, and it is because of this that he is newly requesting a loan that will help him to purchase a calved cow and supplies to feed her. The previous capital was well-invested. It helped him to continue working and avoid dissolving the farm that he had.

For him it is satisfactory knowing that today his family already has better living conditions and are healthy.

loans.use: to purchase a calved cow and supplies to feed her.

loans.name: Ane

texts.en:
Ane is a 38-year-old married woman with six children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, yams and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years.

Ane has requested a loan to buy chemicals, bushknives, fertilizer, a water storage container, a wheelbarrow and a pickaxe.  She has been a member of SPBD since 2005. With her profits, Ane hopes to improve her business and use her business profit for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, bushknives, fertilizer, a water storage container, a wheelbarrow and a pickaxe

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to finish her studies, focusing on graduation expenses.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
"Having a husband abroad doesn’t mean you are financially stable," Clarita says. She is 39 years old, married, and has one child attending school. 

With her determination to help her husband in meeting their needs, Clarita engages herself in a retailing business. She is selling drinks, bread, spices, eggs, and noodles in her sari-sari store. Clarita wants to extend the items she sells and be able to increase her income, as well. 

Clarita wants to borrow a loan, amounting to PHP 20,000, to buy toothpaste, soap, shampoo, and conditioner to sell. She hopes that her business will grow, so that, someday, her sari-sari store becomes a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy toothpaste, soap, shampoo, and conditioner to sell.

loans.name: Sreymao

texts.en:
Sreymao, 41, lives with her common-law husband and has an adult child. Together they have been working as farmers for more than 20 years on their own farm, which they inherited from their parents after their marriage. They currently live and raise their child in a rural village of Prey Chhor district, where they learned everything related to agriculture, especially growing rice and raising poultry. Through their hardships, they are able to earn enough income to maintain their household.

Sreymao, as a hard-working mother who is always dedicated to daily household chores and who pays close attention to taking care of her family members, has requested a loan to build a latrine and buy its accessories.  This will help protect them from disease and keep the environment clean by releasing fewer pollutants. Sreymao is very happy and thankful because HKL has provided her a special interest rate on this loan due to its intended purpose. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to build a latrine and buy its accessories.

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.en: Hilaria has had a general store business for almost five years. She earns a net income of PHP 300 daily.  However, due to a lack of capital, she would like to borrow a loan of PHP 23,000 to purchase beverages, food, spices, bread, coffee, sugar, and noodles to resell in her store. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase beverages, food, spices, bread, coffee, sugar, and noodles to resell in her store

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a farmer from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She has been in the farming business for more than 15 years now. Analyn grows rice in her farm.

Analyn is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of the farm thus augmenting her yield and profit. In the future, Analyn has hopes of making her business a success and a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora is 62 years old and married, the mother of four grown children. Dioscora lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. 

She is engaged in the food-vending business, selling home-cooked snack foods to the people in her place.

Dioscora is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients like flour, sugar, butter, cooking oil, and other items. With this, she will be able to cook and sell more snack foods to the people in her place, thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like flour, sugar, butter, cooking oil, and other items

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita earns a living through her hog raising business. She lives with her family in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. Carmencita has been in the business for more than 10 years now. This is the source of her income.

Carmencita is asking for a loan to buy animal feeds and supplements for the pigs. With this, she will be able to improve her hog raising business thus augmenting her profit and income.

Carmencita hopes to make her business a success and a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds and supplements for the pigs.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan works hard to support her family. Susan is married and has a fruits and vegetables vending business in the Philippines.

Susan requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell. Susan has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Susan would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en: Huong is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new beverage products to restock her cafe. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales. She also hopes that it will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new beverage products.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 38 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. Judith works very hard to provide for them.

Judith runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Judith has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soap, soft drinks and other groceries. 

In the future Judith would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rutchel

texts.en:
Rutchel is 40 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them. Rutchel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like cream, spices, eggs, noodles, soap, etc. She has been in this business for two years.

Rutchel would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like cream, spices, eggs, noodles, soap, etc.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga is requesting a new loan to buy better quality food to sell, to satisfy her customers. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her food stall and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy better quality food to sell.

loans.name: Tam

texts.en:
Tam is requesting a new loan to buy sewing tools, sewing equipment, and materials. 

Tam's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. 

She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers, and increasing her sales. She also hopes that, through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sewing tools, sewing equipment, and materials.

loans.name: Nam

texts.en:
Nam would like to take a further loan to buy materials and tools for baking bread to sell.  Nam's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. 

She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and boosting sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy materials and tools for baking bread to  sell

loans.name: Chi

texts.en:
Chi is requesting a new loan to buy beauty products, such as hair care products and face care products. 

Chi's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. 

She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers, and increasing her sales. She also hopes that, through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy beauty products, such as hair care products and face care products.

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh is requesting a new loan to buy sewing tools, sewing equipment, and materials. Anh's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. 

She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and boosting her sales. 

She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sewing tools, sewing equipment, and materials

loans.name: María Catalina

texts.es:
María de 45 años, vive junto a su esposo de 65 años de edad. Procrearon 2 hijas, que tienen  24 y 20 años de edad respectivamente y un hijo que es técnico electricista. De estos, solo este último vive con ellos, las hijas se han casado.

Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas desde hace más de 20 años,  esta labor la hace con el apoyo de una hermana. Esta actividad la hace desde que el esposo, quedó desempleado. El maíz  y la leña lo compra a comerciantes de la zona, se la llevan hasta el local de trabajo. Este local es el garaje de su vivienda.

El préstamo servirá  para realizar el pago del préstamo vigente en Fundación CAMPO y pagar  a un amigo que le prestó, para solventar un problema de salud del esposo y el resto lo utilizará en la compra de maíz y leña. 

De esta manera, fortalecerá con capital de trabajo y permitir que la familia no tenga un desbalance financiero, por las cuentas por pagar.

Al capitalizarse, podrá comprar el maíz en temporada de cosechas y es donde se encuentra a menor precio, de compra en el mercado y al pagar las deudas, se quedará con una responsabilidad financiera, permitiendo que puedan honrar satisfactoriamente.

Piensa, seguir con el  negocio y apoyar a sus hijos, para que puedan tener sus viviendas.
texts.en:
María, age 45, lives together with her 65 year old husband. They have two daughters, ages 24 and 20 respectively, and a son who is an electrical technician.  Of these, only the last one lives with them; the daughters have gotten married.

For more than twenty years, she has worked making and selling tortillas. She does this work with the support of a sister.  She has been doing this work since her husband became unemployed.  She buys the corn and the firewood from vendors in the area and carries them to her place of business, which is in the garage of her home.

The loan will serve to make the payment on a current loan from Fundación CAMPO and to repay a friend who had lent to her to take care of a health problem for her husband.  She will use the rest to buy corn and firewood.

In this way, she will reinforce her working capital and allow her family to avoid a financial imbalance due to their debts.

After this financing, she will be able to buy corn in the harvest season when it can be found at a lower price in the markets, and will pay her debts. She will still have a financial responsibility, allowing her to be able to honor her debts satisfactorily. 

She plans to continue with her business and support her children so that they can buy their own homes.

loans.use: to complete the payment of an active loan with Fundación CAMPO and to repay a friend who had loaned her money to straighten out a health problem for her husband. The rest she will use to buy corn and firewood.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio’s greatest dream in life is having investment in his village and financing his children's education. Rogelio is engaged in a service business repairing malfunctioned televisions and he also has a hog raising business. He now has his business stall in his village, but before this he provided his services in different villages by going house to house. 

Rogelio wants to expand his business by putting up a piggery business as an additional source of income. He is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy piglets to raise, as well as to buy other materials needed in his electronics repair business. He hopes that his businesses will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise, as well as to buy other materials needed in his electronics repair business

loans.name: Loko Paul

texts.fr: Loko Paul âgé de 58 ans, est marié à une marchande nommée Mahoussi. Le couple a six enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Loko Paul n'a pas fréquenté l'école, mais a appris la menuiserie ; activité qu'il exerce depuis seize ans à son domicile. Loko Paul vit avec sa femme et ses enfants. Les charges de la maison son supportées par le couple. Pour assumer pleinement ses responsabilités, Loko Paul vend de façon parallèle des bois de chauffage. Loko Paul s'approvisionne dans sa région. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Loko Paul sollicite pour la sixième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Loko Paul, aged 58, is married to a merchant named Mahoussi. The couple have six children, some of whom are enrolled in school and all of whom are still their parents' responsibility. 

Loko Paul was not able to attend school, but he learned carpentry, a business activity that he has been in for 16 years, working out of his home. He lives with his wife and children. The household expenses are covered by the couple. 

In order to fully assume his responsibilities, Loko Paul also sells firewood. He stocks up on firewood in his region. Wishing to grow that activity, he is requesting his sixth loan from ALIDé. His prior loans were correctly reimbursed.

loans.use: to buy firewood

loans.name: Ana Cynthia

texts.en:
Ana Cynthia is 52 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom attends school. She operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 28 years.

Ana Cynthia is requesting a loan from NWTF for 30,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more stock such as canned goods, beer, eggs, nuts, etc. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, beer, eggs, nuts, etc.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter lives in the Litein area of Kenya. He has no children, and he has been doing this work for 10 years. His primary income sources are from his farm: milk, eggs, tea.  He is seeking a loan to buy more poultry.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Cultivating." His biggest challenge is "limited capital." 

Peter was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "Low interest." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "How to develop a saving culture."

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked "How will this loan benefit his family?" Peter replied "Better farm yields."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Peter owns the following:  a cow and poultry, but does not own a pig, a pump, a bicycle, a motorcycle, or an automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household mosquito nets and electricity, but does not have solar power, running water, a sewing machine, a TV, or a DVD.

loans.use: To buy poultry.

loans.name: Maria Paz

texts.es:
María, se ha decidido nuevamente a trabajar con crédito para comprar maíz, harina, crema, y otros para la venta de tortillas y quesadilla. Ha incrementado el número de clientes satisfechos, su negocio es más amplio, sus ingresos son mejores lo que le permiten cumplir con sus compromisos económicos. 
Por todo lo bueno antes mencionado les puede brindar  a sus hijos una  mejor alimentación, educación y mejores condiciones de vida en general.
texts.en:
Maria has once again decided to work with a loan to purchase corn, flour, cream, and other ingredients for making and selling tortillas and quesadillas. The numbers of Maria's satisfied customers have increased, her business is more ample, and her income is improved, all of which allows Maria to comply with her economic commitments.

Due to all of these positive factors, Maria is able to offer her children an improved diet, education, and better conditions of life in general.

loans.use: to buy corn, flour, cream, and other ingredients for making tortillas and quesadillas to sell.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong is requesting a new loan to buy ingredients for making cakes. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. 

Huong hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business and in increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making cakes.

loans.name: Tsogtbayar

texts.en:
Tsogtbayar, 49 years old, lives with his wife in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been selling meat to local people by renting a stall at a market since 2003. This is the only source of income for his family, so he decided to rent one more stall to sell diary products. 

For this reason, Tsogtbayar is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to pay the rent and buy diary products at wholesale prices in large amounts for resale. As a result, he will be able to generate more income for his family. This borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to rent a stall and sell diary products

loans.name: Olinda Hilge

texts.es:
Olinda es una mujer de 35 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con su pequeño hijo, ella es madre soltera, trabajadora, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; gracias a su esfuerzo Olinda pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de Administración de Empresas.
Por iniciativa propia, Olinda trabaja como asistente administrativa en una empresa de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Olinda se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada mejorará su vivienda, ya que desea ponerle piso de concreto a la habitación de su hijo, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de terminar la construcción total de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Olinda is a 35-year-old woman who lives in the city of Ica with her young child. She is a hardworking single mother who dedicates all of her efforts towards getting ahead. Thanks to her efforts, Olinda was able to study a Business Administration technical degree.

On her own initiative, Olinda works as an administrative assistant at a business in her city. She works every day for about ten hours, and thinks that it is going very well thanks to her dedication and hard work. 

Olinda is very grateful to Kiva lenders, since she will be able to improve her home thanks to this loan. She would like to install a concrete floor in her son's room. She will continue to work and push herself in order to achieve her dream of finishing the construction of her whole home.

loans.use: to improve her home.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 56 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. Mary runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Mary has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from selling firewood. Mary aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mashauri Group

texts.fr: La cliente  Charlotte est un leader  du de l’association d’affaire « Mashauri », entrepreneur, âgée de 50 ans et mère de 6 enfants qui tous étudient. Son conjoint est un fonctionnaire de l’Administration publique.  La cliente  est une vendeuse de friperie au marché public. Il y a 17 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Elle commença cette activité avec son fonds propre reçu de son époux.  Grace à ce commerce, elle a réalisé plusieurs projets en faveur de ses enfants et pour sa famille. Ce nouveau prêt lui servira d’acheter 1 ballon de friperie. En plus, elle souhaite voir ses enfants obtenir leurs  diplômes universitaires et accroître son activité. Au finish, elle salue l’initiative de Hekima pour son soutien et autonomisation des femmes non bancables surtout dans le contexte actuel de la guerre à l’Est de la République Démocratique du Congo où l’économie n’est pas stable.
texts.en:
Featured borrower Charlotte is a leader of the business group called « Mashauri », an entrepreneur, 50 years of age and the mother of six children who are all in school. Her husband is a civil servant in Public Administration. She herself sells used clothing in the public market. She has been in this business for 17 years. She started up the business with her own money that she received from her husband. 

Thanks to this business, she has managed to do a good deal for her children and for her family. This new loan will allow her to buy one bale of used clothing. She would like to see her children get university diplomas and also to grow her business. Finally, she would like to salute Hekima for its initiative supporting women who don't have access to financial services and helping them become self-sufficient, especially in the present context of the war in the eastern part of the Democratic Republic of the Congo, where the economy is not stable.

loans.use: to buy one bale of used clothing

loans.name: Julio C. Tello Al Progreso Group

texts.es: El grupo “JULIO C. TELLO AL PROGRESO” está  conformada por 08 socias quienes se dedican a diversas actividades del comercio minoristas. Floriana tiene 58 años es conviviente con hijos independientes. En el grupo cumple la función de presidenta hace 20 años se dedica a la venta comida, golosinas, gaseosas y frutas en un quiosco en las afueras de su vivienda. Años atrás se dedicaba a la venta de menú en un mercado. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de víveres, golosinas y gaseosas. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Floriana es la segunda persona sentada del lado izquierdo viste chompa blanca.
texts.en:
The “Julio C. Tello Al Progreso” Group is composed of 8 members who are dedicated to diverse commercial retail activities. 

Floriana, president of the group, is 58 years old, married, and her children are now independent. For the last 20 years, she has sold food, candy, soft drinks, and fruit in a kiosk outside her house. Years ago, she used to sell meals in a public market. Floriana will invest her loan in purchasing groceries, candy, and soft drinks. Floriana is the 2nd person seated from the left of the picture and is wearing a white sweater.

The Group is grateful to Kiva investors for the offer of a loan.

loans.use: buy groceries, candy, and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Christopher lives in the Kericho area of Kenya, which lies in the tea growing region of Kenya. He has ten children, and he has been agriculture for 30 years. His primary income sources are from his farm:  milk, eggs, tea.  He is seeking a loan to buy more poultry.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Dairy farming."  His biggest challenge is "dairy feeds and market of dairy product."  Animals on the farm have been given the names of "Tuiyei."

Christopher was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied:  "Because of low interest rate and easy mode of repayment." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "Records are kept in passbook, which shows the payment of an individual."

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked how will this loan benefit his family, Christopher replied, "Farm output will increase."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Christopher owns the following:  a cow and poultry, but does not own a pig, a pump, a bicycle, a motorcycle, or an automobile.  This borrower has in the household mosquito nets, electricity, running water, a TV, and a DVD, but does not have solar power or a sewing machine.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher lives in the Kericho area of Kenya, which lies in the tea-growing region of Kenya. He has 10 children and has been in agriculture for 30 years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, and tea.

He stated that he finds dairy farming the most enjoyable aspect of farming. His biggest challenge is dairy feeds and the market of dairy products. One of the animals on the farm has been given the name Tuiyei.

When asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, Christopher replied, "because of the low interest rate and easy mode of repayment." Christopher was also asked what he learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session. He said, "Records are kept in a passbook, which shows the payment of an individual."

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked how the loan will benefit his family, Christopher said that it will help him construct a cow shed that will give his cows a conducive environment for more milk production. Christopher owns the following: a cow and poultry. He does not own a pig, a pump, a bicycle, a motorcycle, or an automobile. In his household, he has a mosquito net, electricity, running water, a TV, and a DVD player, but he does not have solar power or a sewing machine.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and sent the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To construct a cow shed

loans.name: Nasika

texts.en:
Nasika lives in Mombasa, Kenya.  She is 68 years old and married, with seven adult children. 

She has been running a water-vending business for the last four years, and the business has been picking up well. She knew Milango through friends who invited her to join so that she could save and also be able to access funding for her small business. 

She now seeks a loan to repair water tanks and pipes for her business. She wants to add more taps of water in the next five years despite the challenge of water shortage and rationing. She will use extra that she will raise to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to repair water tanks and pipes for her water business

loans.name: Channa

texts.en:
Channa, 38, is married and the mother of two children, one of whom is married. Channa only studied up to the fifth class of elementary school. She stayed out of school when her parents were experiencing financial difficulties, so she learned to cultivate the land at a very young age. This is a tradition of family farming, which has been passed on for generations. Thanks to her parents and to her business, she is able to make a decent income to maintain her household.

At the moment Channa, being a good homemaker who is always dedicated to daily household chores and who provides care to her family members, has requested a loan to build a latrine and buy its accessories. This will protect them from disease and keep the environment clean by releasing fewer pollutants. Channa will use with the remaining balance of loan to pay for her household expenses. She is very happy and thankful because HKL has provided her a special interest rate on this loan due to its intended purpose. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to build a latrine and buy its accessories.

loans.name: Silvia Patricia

texts.es:
Silvia, opta por la oportunidad de invertir nuevamente en su panadería para incrementar más la variedad de productos y generar ingresos, con el crédito anterior ella amplio su negocio solvento la deuda adquirida. En está ocasión estará comprando azúcar, harinas, levadura y otros ingredientes que son necesarios para la elaboración de pan.
Su familia sigue apoyándola en su actividad todos están muy bien de salud y grupo familiar sigue siendo el mismo.
texts.en: Silvia has decided to invest in her bakery once again to further increase the variety of products and generate income. With the last loan she expanded her business by paying off her acquired debt. This time Silvia will buy sugar, flour, yeast and other products she needs to make bread. Her family continues to support her in her efforts. They are all well and the family situation remains the same.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, yeast and other ingredients.

loans.name: Beatriz Esmeralda

texts.es:
Beatriz de 37 años, vive junto a sus hijos, todos varones: de 19 años, estudia 2ª año de bachillerato, trabaja como ayudante de albañil y en la elaboración de pan, el que tiene 18 años, estudia primer año de bachillerato en logística y adunas, el de 7 años de edad que estudia en kinder- preparatoria y el de 4 años de edad, que está al cuidado de la mamá. Viven en casa de  los suegros.

Ella se dedica a vender comida (almuerzos), esto lo hace en la casa donde reside y sus clientes son personas que trabajan en tiendas y farmacias de la zona, vende leña en su casa, a los  vecinos; también, vende ropa, cosméticos y joyas enchapadas, esto lo hace al detalle y visita a sus clientes a las viviendas. Estas actividades las hace desde hace más de 15 años, manifiesta que inicio en estas actividades, buscando apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares. 

El préstamo servirá para adquirir mercadería nueva, refiriéndose a ropa y cosméticos; también, comprara unas mesas y sillas para instalar un pequeño comedor, en el garaje de su casa.
 
La inversión, servirá para que esta familia, pueda emprender sus actividades de negocio y mejorar los ingresos que generen las utilidades suficientes, para afrontar los gastos de preparación académica de sus miembros.

Pretende, mejorar las condiciones de su negocio y establecer una panadería, considerando que uno de sus hijos sabe ese oficio.
texts.en:
Beatriz, 37 years old, lives with her children, all boys: a 19-year-old who is studying in his second year of high school and works as an assistant bricklayer and baking bread; the 18-year-old who is studying in his first year of vocational high school in logistics and customs; the 7-year-old who is a primary school student; and the 4-year-old who is cared for by the mother. They live in her in-laws’ home.

She makes a living selling food (lunch). This she does in the home where she resides, and her customers are people who work in stores and pharmacies in the area. She sells firewood from her home to her neighbors. Also, she sells clothing, cosmetics, and plated jewelry. She does this retail and also visits her customers in their homes. She has done these activities for more than 15 years. She states that she began these activities looking to support her husband with the family expenses.

The loan with allow her to acquire new merchandise, referring to clothing and cosmetics. Also, she will buy new tables and seats to place in a small dining room in the garage of her home.

The investment will allow this family to be able to undertake their business activities and improve their incomes. This will generate sufficient profits to face the expenses for the academic preparation of the members of her family.

She hopes to improve the conditions of her business and establish a bakery, considering that one of her sons knows this trade.

loans.use: to acquire new merchandise, referring to clothing and cosmetics, and to purchase some tables and chairs to place in a small dining room in the garage of her home.

loans.name: Reinerio

texts.es: Reinerio, tiene 34 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa con quien tiene tres hijos y reside en el municipio de San Nicolás, Santa Barbara. Hace 10 años que se dedica al cultivo propio y producción de café. Anteriormente trabajaba para otros productores de café como jornalero.  EL prestamo que solicito es por 12,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de fertilizantes y limpieza para la finca porque ya se aproxima la cosecha. Esta inversión le ayuda a solventar la necesidad de dinero y asi poderle dar un mejor mantenimiento a la finca de café. El objetivo para el es superarse a través del trabajo y la inversión en su finca y para que su familia tengan lo necesario.
texts.en:
Reinerio is 34 years old. He lives with his common-law wife and their three children in the municipality of San Nicolás, Santa Barbara. 10 years ago he started to cultivate and produce coffee on his own. Before that he worked as labor on other people's plantations.

The 12,000 HNL loan Reinerio is requesting will be invested in buying fertilizer and cleaning his plantation as the harvest is approaching. The loan will give him the money needed to properly maintain his crops . His objective is to excel through work and the investment in his plantation so that his family has everything it needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and clean his plantation.

loans.name: Gbenonkpo 2 Group

texts.fr: GBENONKPO 2 est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Élisabeth Jocelyne(celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 42 ans. Élisabeth Jocelyne n'a pas fréquenté l’école.  Élisabeth Jocelyne est veuve avec quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Élisabeth Jocelyne vit avec ses enfants. Les charges de ménage sont supportées par Élisabeth Jocelyne. Pour répondre aux besoins de ses enfants, Élisabeth Jocelyne vend des sacs de charbon et du bois de chauffage à son domicile depuis huit ans. Élisabeth Jocelyne s'approvisionne dans sa région. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Élisabeth Jocelyne s’associe aux autres membres du groupe GBENONKPO 2 pour solliciter un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Gbenonkpo 2 is a group made up of 3 people who live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, named Élisabeth Jocelyne (pictured with her hand raised in the photo) is 42 years old. She did not attend school. Élisabeth Jocelyne is a widow with four children, all of whom attend school and are in her care. She lives with her children, and takes care of all the household expenses.

In order to provide for her children's needs, Élisabeth Jocelyne has been selling bags of charcoal and firewood from her home for the last 8 years. She stocks up in her region. She has partnered with the other members of Gbenonkpo 2 to request a second loan from ALIDé; their first loan was fully repaid.

loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal and firewood

loans.name: Jhon Edison

texts.es: Jhon es un campesino del oriente antioqueño, casado y padre de 2 hijos de 6 y 2 años de edad.  Aprendió las labores del campo, gracias a su hermano mayor y cuando era joven trabajaba como agricultor en diferentes fincas de la región, pero decidió independizarse y montar su propio negocio, una curtiembre con la que ha generado los ingresos necesarios para llevar el sustento a su hogar, sin embargo, con el ánimo de complementar los ingresos que recibe, desea reiniciar su actividad de agricultor y quiere iniciar su cultivo con una siembra de  arveja en un terreno arrendado; es por esta razón que se anima a solicitar el crédito con el que comprará insumos agrícolas al por mayor (semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas) y además pagará 20 horas de alquiler de tractor para picar el terreno para la siembra; de esta manera podrá dar inicio a su nuevo proyecto productivo y podrá generar mejores ingresos para seguir velando por el bienestar de su familia. Jhon desea trabajar arduamente para llegar a cumplir el sueño de tener un terreno propio en el que pueda sembrar sus cultivos y disminuir los costos de producción, lo que le permitirá tener la oportunidad de mejorar las condiciones de vida y el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en: Jhon is a farmer from eastern Antioquia. He is married and is the father of 2 children, aged 6 and 2.  His older brother taught him to farm, and when he was young he used to work on different farms in the region, but he decided to become independent and start up his own business.  He has a tannery with which he generates the income he needs to support his household.  However, with the goal of supplementing his income, he wants to go back to agriculture, planting peas on some rented land.  This is why he is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies at wholesale (seeds, chemical and organic fertilizers, and pesticides).  He will also use the loan to rent a tractor for 20 hours to prepare the land to cultivate the crops.  In this way, he will be able to start up his new project, so that he can generate more income to continue to safeguard the welfare of his family.  Jhon wants to work very hard so that he can accomplish his dream: to have his own land where he could cultivate his crops.  This would reduce his production costs, allowing him to have an opportunity to improve his family's living conditions and welfare.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides, and to rent a tractor

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en: Amelia is 32 years old and lives in the town of West Point. She is single and has two children, aged 8 and 14. Her children live with her and are attending school. Amelia sells rice, pepper, oil, vita (a juice drink), etc. in the local market; she has been doing this for five years. She is going to buy additional rice, pepper, oil, vita, etc. for her business. She says sometimes the business is very good and she has good profits, and sometimes it's slow and she doesn't make any money. She likes having customers around. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to buy additional rice, pepper, oil, vita, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to be able to buy agricultural supplies with which she will improve her coffee crops.

loans.name: Boubou

texts.fr:
L’emprunteur s’appelle Boubou, âgé de 32 ans, marié et père de famille. Boubou  s’active dans le commerce de denrées alimentaires depuis plus de 5 ans. Il possède une boutique qu’il a ouverte avec ses propres moyens et un capital peu consistant qu’il avait épargné depuis un bout de temps. C’est dans le cadre du renforcement de la boutique, qu’il veut avoir un crédit à l’IMCEC pour acheter des denrées alimentaires telles que du riz, de l’huile, du sucre.
Boubou gère les charges quotidiennes de sa famille grâce aux recettes de son activité.
Puisse que c’est un début, il va faire avec cette somme acquis, seulement pour ne manquer d’aucunes marchandise susceptible d’être vendu et de rapporter un profit, Boubou aura besoin d’une somme aussi consistante que possible avec la collaboration de l’IMCEC.
texts.en:
This borrower's name is Boubou; he is 32 years old, married, and the father of a family. Boubou has been selling food supplies for over 5 years. He has a shop which he opened with his own funds and some small capital which he had saved for some time. In order to expand his shop, he is requesting a loan from IMCEC to purchase food supplies such as rice, oil, and sugar. 

Boubou is able to provide for his family's daily expenses with the earnings from his business. Because it is just the beginning, he will use the loan proceeds he receives only to ensure that he isn't missing out on any merchandise that can be resold to earn a profit. He will need as much capital as possible with the help of IMCEC.

loans.use: to purchase food supplies such as rice, oil, and sugar to sell in his shop

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
El señor José Luis de 29  años de edad,  tiene 1 hijo  que dependen de él, vive con su esposa en casa propia y está ubicada en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 04  años al negocio de venta ropa usada y calzado.
Don José Luis es un hombre emprendedor que desea salir adelante con su negocio y así poder aportar mejor ingreso a su familia para cambiar su estilo de vida.
Don José Luis está solicitando el préstamo para compra  de cuatro fardos de ropa que incluyan blusas, faldas, pantalones, vestidos, camisetas, etc. también quiere comprar zapatos,  con el apoyo del crédito desea mejorar su negoció y por ende su calidad de vida.
Su sueño es mejorar su negocio y si Prisma le da la oportunidad continuara trabajando ya que desea mejorar un microbús en donde le también transporta estudiantes a la escuela bilingüe en Choluteca.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Septiembre del 2013
texts.en:
José Luis is 29  years old. He lives with his wife and one child who is dependent on him. They live in their own home in the community of San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras. For the past four years he has been selling used clothing and shoes. José Luis is an entrepreneurial person who wants to get ahead with his business in order to generate more income for his family to change their lifestyle.

José Luis is requesting this loan to buy four bales of clothing including blouses, skirts, pants, dresses, T-shirts, etc. He also wants to buy shoes. With the assistance of this loan he hopes to improve his business and in the end, his quality of life. His dream is to improve his business. If Prisma gives him the opportunity to continue working he also wants to fix up a micro-bus which he uses to transport children to the bilingual school in Choluteca.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - September 2013

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, pants, dresses, T-shirts, shoes, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Juan Jose De La Cruz

texts.es:
Juan, está casado, vive con su esposa y su hijo de 17 años, se dedica a su actividad de crianza de ganado y siembra de granos básicos. Esté negocio lo heredo de sus padres; hace 30 años lo desempeña con sus hijos, sus jornadas son de 5:00 a.m. a 2:00 p.m.; él aprovecha todos los recursos  no paga por alquiler de terreno para el ganado, pues de la cosecha también sale el alimento para el ganado.
Solicita un préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas (herbicidas, abonos e insecticidas), para la siembra de granos básicos, además agregara la siembra de hortalizas con lo que el incrementara sus ganancias y así pagara la deuda adquirida.
Su sueño es ampliar su negocio para que su familia no tenga limitantes y así tener una vida con mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Juan is married and lives with his wife and their 17-year-old child. He makes a living by raising farm animals and growing bulk grains. He inherited this business from his parents, and he has been working in agriculture for 30 years alongside his children. He works daily from 5:00 am to 2:00 pm and takes advantage of all the resources available to him. He doesn't pay to rent the land where he raises livestock, and the harvest also provides feed for the animals.

He is requesting a loan to buy agricultural inputs, including herbicides, fertilizers and insecticides. He will use these when he is planting bulk grains. In addition, he will plant some vegetables, which will increase his earnings and allow him to pay back the debt he is taking on.

Juan's dream is to expand his business so that his family won't have as many constraints, and to achieve better living conditions in this way.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs, such as herbicides, fertilizers, and insecticides.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina lives in Bagumbang, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental with her family. Her husband is a farmer and he often goes fishing to earn a living. She has been raising pigs for 8 years to bolster to her husband's income. She sometimes helps her husband on the farm to earn extra income. She is hopeful that she can gain profit and wants to improve her family's living standards in the future.

loans.use: to buy a piglet to raise.

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita works hard to support her family. Sheis married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Marianita requested a 11000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her fish stall.

Marianita has been in this business for 20 years now.

Marianita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her fish stall.

loans.name: Joanne Del Pilar

texts.es:
Joanne es una mujer de 25 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con sus padres y hermanos, ella es trabajadora, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Joanne pudo estudiar la carrera profesional para ser Maestra de Educación Inicial.
Por iniciativa propia Joanne trabaja como auxiliar en un colegio inicial de su ciudad, adicionalmente tiene un pequeño negocio donde brinda servicios de manicura, pedicure, maquillaje y otros, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Joanne se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará una moto lineal de segunda mano, la cual utilizará para transportarse hasta donde sus clientes para brindar sus servicios a domicilio, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener un gran spa.
texts.en:
Joanne is a single 25 year old woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa with her parents and siblings. She is hard-working and enthusiastic and puts all her efforts into getting on in life. Thanks to the hard work and support of her parents, Joanne was able to study for a professional career as a pre-school teacher. Through her own initiative Joanne works as an assistant in a pre-school in her city. She also has a small business providing manicure, pedicure, make-up and other services. She works 10 hours a day and thinks things are going well for her because of her dedication and her friendly way with other people.

Joanne is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help provided she will buy a second hand motorcycle, which she will use for getting to her clients in order to take her services to their homes. By doing this she will be able to continue working and striving to achieve her big dream of having a large spa.

loans.use: to buy a second hand motorcycle.

loans.name: Neneth

texts.en: Neneth is single and works hard to support her family by running a ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell. She has been in this business for four years and her goal is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more ready-to-wear items to sell

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Sophy is married and has two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in her own house, which has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a motorcycle business. She faces major challenges of motorcycle breakdown and muddy roads during the rainy season. She dreams of buying a new motorcycle and developing herself.

With the loan of 30,0000 KSH, she wants to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle

loans.name: Amani

texts.en: Amani used his first loan to buy a motorbike. This improved his business and he is happy that he was able to repay the loan without many challenges. His life has improved and he now seeks to buy another motorbike to add to his current inventory. His long term ambition is to own a public service transport business despite the challenges of competition and weather changes. He will use the income that he will raise from the business pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy another motorbike.

loans.name: Jeneth

texts.en:
Jeneth, 21, is married and has two children. She resides in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She helps her husband in operating their own farm, cultivating rice. This is the family's main source of income and how they make a living.

Her previous loan from GDMPC, which she used in their farm, was successfully repaid. Now she plans to grow a new variety of seedlings, for she is sure that it will give them a better harvest. Without hesitation, she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC. She will use this loan to purchase the new variety of seeds to plant. She wants to improve the general living conditions of her family, in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a new variety of seeds to plant

loans.name: Junior Alfredo

texts.es:
Junior tiene 31 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Chincha y trabaja en una empresa textil de su ciudad como empleado en el área de tintorería, con este trabajo puede tener los ingresos para poder solventar los gastos de su familia, ya que vive al lado de su pareja con la cual tienen 3 hijos de 10,9 y 3 años, a quienes quiere mucho y por quienes se esfuerza para salir adelante.

Junior agradece a los prestamistas kiva por el apoyo que le están brindando ya que gracias a ello podrá comprar materiales de construcción para realizar mejoras en la vivienda donde habita y poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:”  Tener una vivienda de material noble y darle una profesión a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Junior, 31, lives in the city of Chincha and works  as a dyer for a textile firm in his city.  He earns income this way to cover his family expenses since he lives with his spouse and three children who are 10, 9 and 3 years old and who he loves very much and strives for in order to get ahead.

Junior is grateful to Kiva lenders for the support they are providing him because thanks to it he will be able to buy building supplies to make improvements to the house he lives in and make his greatest dream reality: to have a house built of substantial materials and to provide education for his children.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a dairy unit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 200 bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Santos Ándres

texts.es:
Santos de 58 años, tiene un grado de estudio de noveno grado, vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos, la esposa tiene un pequeño cafetín  en la escuela, los 3 hijos están estudian, la mayor  está estudiando bachillerato, y los dos están en la escuela. 

La actividad que realiza Santos,  consiste en realizar  viajes en su micro-bus a diferentes partes del país, él cuenta con más de 10 años de experiencia con la actividad que realiza.  

El préstamo lo necesito para invertirlos, en el vehículo con el cual trabaja, lo mandaría a reparar debido a que manifestó que le está dando problemas.
El señor planifica seguir trabajando, haciendo viajes para poder darle la educación necesaria a sus hijos, y que sus hijos vayan a la universidad.
texts.en:
Santos, 58, completed ninth grade.  He lives with his wife and three children.  His wife has a small snack bar at the school and their three children are attending school.  The oldest is in high-school and the other two in primary school.

Santos' work consisting in driving his mini-bus on trips to different places in the country.  He has more than ten years’ experience doing this.

He needs the loan to invest in the vehicle he works with.  He will send it to be repaired because it’s having some mechanical problems.  He plans to continue working making these trips in order to be able to provide his children with education so that they can attend university.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Rickson

texts.en:
Rickson is a farmer. He is 31 years old and lives with his family, in the village of Antagan 1st. He is married and has two children. He owns a farm lot, and at the same time he is the one who manages it well. He wishes to borrow PHP20,000. He will use the loan to buy farm inputs, like fertilizer, insecticide, and seed variety. 

He used to till and harvest his crops twice a year, and he is doing his best to earn greater income. The income he has gained from farming went toward meeting his family's basic needs. Rickson describes the state of his family as simple, yet happy, through the guidance and grace of God.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, like fertilizer, insecticide and seed variety.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Noelia Luz

texts.es:
Noelia es una mujer de 21 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres y hermanos, ella es muy trabajadora, entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Noelia se encuentra estudiando la carrera técnica de Administración de Empresas.
Por iniciativa propia, Noelia trabaja como vendedora en un supermercado de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y buen desempeño.
Noelia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada realizara el mejoramiento de una habitación en su vivienda, ya que desea ponerle piso y tarrajearla, así pues Noelia seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Noelia, 21, is single living  with her parents and siblings in the city of Chincha.  She’s very hardworking, enthusiastic and with a strong drive for self-improvement.  Thanks to her efforts and her parents’ support, Noelia’s studying the technical career of Business Administration.

On her own initiative, Noelia works as a saleswoman in a supermarket in her city.  She works every day for about 10 hours and believes she does well because of her dedication and good work habits.

Noelia’s very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided she will be able to do some improvements to one of the bedrooms at home for she wants to install flooring and seal the walls.  Noelia will continue working and striving to reach her great dream: to have a house of her own.

loans.use: to do some home improvements.

loans.name: Vecitacion

texts.en: Vecitacion is 29 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for her family by selling soft drinks and coconut wine in the Philippines, and is requesting a loan for PHP 8,000 loan from NWTF to buy additional stocks of soft drinks and a gallon of coconut wine to sell. Vecitacion has been in this business for two years and would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and a gallon of coconut wine.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma earns an income by making charcoal out of coconut shells and selling it to her customers. She has been in this business for five years and works hard to support her family. She lives with her husband and children in the Leyte area of the Philippines.

Elma has requested a PhP 8,000 loan through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy additional stocks of coconut shells for her business.

In the future, Elma would like to save enough money to allow her to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy stocks of coconut shells for her charcoal usiness

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa, a 31-year-old married mother of three children, two of whom are in school, is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For three years now, Marissa has operated a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional coconut wine to sell.

In the future, Marissa would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai, 46 years old, is married and has two children. Her husband earns money working for a local company. Mai supports the family also, through the income she earns from running the business of buying and selling gas. She has run this business for ten years. She lives with her family, in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Mai intends to take a loan to increase her working capital and buy gas tanks for selling. The additional buying will enable her to increase her sales. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy gas tanks for selling

loans.name: Dong

texts.en: Dong is 41 years old and married with two children. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City, where he and his wife earn a living by running a stationery store that sells office products. They started the store six years ago, and Dong is requesting this loan to gradually expand his business by buying a variety of different office products to sell to his customers. He hopes his business will run smoothly and help him to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a variety of different office products to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Taarifakhan

texts.ru: Таарифахан 42 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Таарифахан - среднее образование, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Таарифахан занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 1,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Таарифахан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная  корова, 1 теленок, а также имеет земельный надел, мерою 2,60 ГА на котором она ежегодно выращивает кукурузу и пшеницу. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Таарифахан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков с дальнейшим откормом. Доходы от кредита Таарифахан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на образование своим детям.
texts.en:
Taarifakhan is 42 years old, married, and with her husband is raising four children. Taarifakhan has a high school education. As an additional source of income for her family, Taarifakhan is engaged in raising livestock and agriculture, having started 20 years ago with the purchase of cattle for 1,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Taarifakhan today has on her homestead: one dairy cow and one calf, and also has an allotment of land, measuring 2.60 hectares on which annually she grows corn and wheat. Monthly income consists of 12,000 som (KGS). 

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Taarifakhan turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase calves for further fattening. 

Taarifakhan plans to invest income from the loan to further increase the quantity of domestic livestock, and plans to save resources на образование своим детям.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Zulfikor

texts.ru: Зулфикор добрый человек, который имеет высшее образование. Он живет и работает на северной части Таджикистана. Зулфикор родился в 1958 года. Он более 33 года работает в средней школе. Он преподает английский язык. Зулфикор является одним из успешных учителей и имеет огромный опыт. Он воспитывает 4 детей. Зулфикор всегда мечтал, чтобы его дети получили высшее образование. Его жена Мухарам поддерживает его всегда и во всем. Его дочь учится в Медицинском университете. Он должен оплатить за учебный договор своей дочери и с такой целью он обратился за займом. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 900 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Zulfikor is a good person who has a higher education. He lives and works in the northern part of Tajikistan. Zulfikor was born in 1958. For more than 33 years, he has been working at a high school. He teaches English. Zulfikor is one of the most successful teachers and has lots of experience. 

He is bringing up four children. Zulfikor always dreamed that his children would receive a higher education. His wife Mukharam supports him always and in everything. 

His daughter is studying at the Medical University. He must pay tuition for his daughter and with this goal is requesting a loan. He is requesting a loan of US$900 to pay tuition.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's tuition at the Medical University

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en: Felicidad is a farmer who lives in the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is married and the mother of six children. She has been in the farming business for more than 30 years now, and is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm. This will allow her to improve the productivity of her farm and increase both her output and profits. In the future, Felicidad hopes to expand her farm so that it will generate more income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm

loans.name: Sang

texts.en:
Sang is 31 years old and married. He has one son. He lives with his family, in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. He and his wife earn income running a general store, which they started five years ago.

He intends to take a loan to gradually expand his business, by buying a variety of different beverages and household items to sell to his customers. He hopes his business runs smoothly and will help him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a variety of different beverages and household items to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Siena

texts.en:
Siena is a married woman with four children, three of whom are still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Siena is 40 years old.

Siena has a business selling vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell.

Siena has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Siena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma works hard to support her family. Thelma is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell to her customers. Thelma has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Thelma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
From Ho Chi Minh City, Nga is 43 years old and married to a teacher. Nga has been running a cafe and  general store in front of her door for five years, a business she started to cover her expenses and help raise her child. 

Nga is requesting a loan to expand her business through the purchase of more food products and a variety of soft drinks. She hopes that the loan will  enable her to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest in her enterprise in the future.

loans.use: to buy food products and a variety of soft drinks to stock in her store

loans.name: Sang

texts.en: Sang is a 32-year-old married man who lives with two children and wife in Ho Chi Minh City. His wife earns money by running a cafe, and for the last ten years, he has run a business servicing trucks by changing their oil and cleaning them. Sang would like a loan to buy better-quality lubricant products and cleaning tools. He hopes this will allow him to better meet the needs of his customers and attract additional customers. He also hopes that through his loan he will be able to increase his income and save money for his family.

loans.use: to buy better quality lubricants and cleaning tools

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is 47 years old and married. Her husband supports his family by buying and selling used oil. Hoa has been running a general store in front of her door for five years. She started this business to cover her expenses and to raise her child. Hoa and her family live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Hoa is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more food products and many kinds of household items so that she will be able to increase sales in her business. Through the loan, she hopes that she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more food products and household items

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
Doña Zoila es una mujer casada de 54 años de edad, emprendedora, luchadora la cual tiene seis años de educación pudiendo completar la primaria en su totalidad por lo que se encuentra muy agradecida por el esfuerzo, apoyo y sacrificio que sus padres hicieron en su juventud. Ella es ama de casa y agricultora dedicándose a la caficultura desde muy joven gracias a sus padres y practicando la cría de cerdos desde hace 2 años lo que aprendió por sí misma. Ella ve como día con día puede generar más ingresos para su familia a pesar de las dificultades que se presentan en la zona ya que no es de mucho desarrollo pero ve necesidades como la costura que es otro de los oficios que ella practica mientras no está en el campo. El terreno que ella cultiva y trabaja es propio el cual lo heredo de parte de sus padres y está ubicado a una hora de camino de su casa de habitación. 

Sus sueños y metas a futuro es poder armar una mejor porqueriza, crecer en su negocio ya que tiene mucha fe en el a pesar de las dificultades que se dan por la alimentación de los animales ya que ella no les da otro alimento que no sea concentrado para tener una buena calidad de producto. También sacar adelante sus cultivos de café ya que entre más ellos generen ingresos para su familia un mejor futuro les brindara a sus hijos. Por lo que ella solicita un financiamiento para poder empezar a fortalecer su sueño con el cual comprara 2 cerdos y 6 sacos de concentrado mejorando el volumen de animales como también la porqueriza la cual necesita una mejora en cuanto al plantel para evitar un mal higiene de los animales.
texts.en:
Zoila is an enterprising and tenacious married woman who is 54 years old.  She has a 6th grade education, and she is very grateful for the efforts, support, and sacrifices that her parents made in her youth so that she could complete her elementary education.  She is a housewife who has also been a coffee farmer from a very young age, thanks to her parents.  She has also been raising pigs for 2 years, an activity that she taught herself.  Zoila sees how each day she can generate more income for her family in spite of the difficulties that arise in the area.  Even though the area is not very developed, she sees that there is a need for dressmaking, which is another of the economic activities that she carries out when she is not in the fields.  The land that she cultivates and works is her own; she inherited it from her parents.  The land is located an hour away from her home.

Zoila's dreams and goals for the future are to build a better pigpen and grow her business, because she has a lot of faith in it, in spite of the difficulties she faces in feeding her animals.  She doesn't give her animals anything but concentrate, so that she can get good quality products.  In addition, she continues to work on her coffee crops, because these generate income for her family so that she can provide her children with a better future.  

Zoila is requesting a loan to work toward these dreams.  She will buy 2 pigs and 6 sacks of concentrate (feed), improving the volume of her animals.  She will also make improvements to her pigpen to avoid having bad hygiene for her animals.

loans.use: to buy pigs and to make her pigpen more hygienic

loans.name: Habiba

texts.ru: Хабиба с юных лет помогало отцу по купле продажей. Она умная и находчивая женщина. Хабиба после того как вышла замуж нигде не работала и занималась воспитанием детей. В семье работал один ее муж. Его доход не хватал для обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами, и они жили очень бедно. Хабиба была вынуждена организовать свой бизнес и найти дополнительный источник дохода. Таким образом, 4 года назад, она начала свой бизнес купле продажей хозяйственных товаров. Она продает свой товар на арендованном магазине. Хабиба хочет расширить свой оборотный капитал. Ее муж находится в России и поэтому она основная кормилица семьи. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1100 долларов США для покупки хозяйственных товаров для расширения оборотного капитала. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Habiba from a young age helped her father in his trade business. She is a clever and resourceful woman. After she got married, Habiba did not work anywhere and took care of the children. In the family, only her husband worked. His income was not enough to provide the family with all the necessities, and they lived very poorly. 

Habiba was compelled to establish her own business and to find an additional source of income. In this way, four years ago she started her own business trading household goods. She sells her goods in a rented store. Habiba wants to expand her working capital. Her husband is in Russia and therefore she is the main breadwinner for the family. 

She is requesting a loan of US$1,100 to buy household products to expand her working capital.

loans.use: to buy household products for increasing working capital

loans.name: Lizeth Fiorela

texts.es:
Lizeth es una joven de 19 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con sus padres y hermanos, ella es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Lizeth no ha podido estudia una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Lizeth trabaja como empleada del hogar en algunas viviendas cercanas a si hogar, ella brinda servicios de limpieza, cocina, lavado y otros,Lizeth trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Lizeth se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprara una computadora, ya que en poco tiempo desea iniciar sus estudios de enfermería y dese contar con una buena herramienta de estudios, así pues Lizeth seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ser una buena profesional.
texts.en:
Lizeth, 19, is a single young woman living with her parents and siblings in the city of Ica.  She’s very hardworking and enthusiastic and has a strong self-improvement drive.  Sadly, for lack of economic resources and the need to start working, Lizeth has been unable to study a professional career.

On her own initiative, Lizeth works in various nearby homes as a domestic employee doing cleaning, cooking, laundry and other chores.  She works every day for about 10 hours and believes she does well because of her dedication and effort.

Lizeth’s very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided she will buy a computer because she’s planning to start nursing courses shortly and wants to have a good work tool handy.  Lizeth will thus continue working and striving to attain her great dream of becoming a good professional.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Zenia

texts.es:
La señora Zenia es una mujer emprendedora y micro empresaria de su comunidad, cuenta con un pequeño local desde hace 6 años donde el producto que vende son derivados de la leche como ser mantequilla, cuajada, queso, tambien vende refrescos y ropa nueva.
Doña Zenia es madre soltera y gracias a este negocio a salido adelante, su negocio es muy visitado porque la calidad del producto que vende es de muy buena y sus precios son realmente bajos, ella solicita el apoyo del préstamo para la compra de queso, mantequilla, quesillo y huevos para surtir su negocio.
Doña Zenia para iniciar este negocio tuvo que solicitar préstamos a proveedores los cuales le dan a otro valor la mercadería y la ganancia era poca, sueña con tener un local mejor surtido y tener productos nuevos para atender mejor a los cliente y poder vender más variedad, la foto muestra su negocio y a su esposo. 




Danlí, Honduras – Septiembre 2013
texts.en:
Zenia is an enterprising woman and a small businesswoman in her community. She has had a small shop for 6 years where she sells products derived from milk such as butter, curd cheese and cheese and she also sells drinks and new clothing. Zenia is a single mother and thanks to this business she has made progress in life. She has a lot of customers visiting her business because the quality of the products she sells is very good and her prices are really low.

She is asking for the backing of the loan in order to buy cheese, butter, fresh cheese and eggs to stock her business. In order to set this business up Zenia had to ask for loans from suppliers which affected the price of her stock and the profit was very small. She dreams of having a better stocked shop and having new products so she can attend to her customers better and be able to sell a bigger variety.

The photo shows her business and her husband.




Danlí, Honduras – September 2013

loans.use: to buy cheese, butter, fresh cheese and eggs for her business.

loans.name: Idalia Isabel

texts.es:
Idalia, necesita capital de trabajo para invertir en su panadería en la compra de harinas, levadura, aceite, azúcar, y otros insumos. Con el crédito anterior ella compro la materia prima necesaria para trabajar en la panadería y generar los ingresos necesarios para ir pagando el crédito.
Sus condiciones económicas son mejores, la familia sigue teniendo el mismo núcleo, todos se encuentran saludables.
texts.en: Idalia needs working capital to invest in her bakery with the purchase of flour, yeast, oil, sugar and other ingredients.  She used her previous loan to buy raw materials needed to work in the bakery and generate income needed to repay the loan.  Her economic conditions are improved, her immediate family is unchanged and all are in good health.

loans.use: to buy baking supplies.

loans.name: Hugo Ernesto

texts.es:
