When asked what she finds most enjoyable about farming, she tells us that it serves as her source of income. She reports that her biggest challenge is 'poor roads and lack of market.' She chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because of the low interest rate offered. When asked what she learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session, she replied, 'Client friendly, low interest rate.' She feels that that this loan will benefit her family by allowing her to improve the family's standard of living.

Magret reports that she owns the following a cow and poultry but does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, a sewing machine, a TV, or a DVD player.

She is requesting this loan in order to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Sha'migul

texts.ru: Шаъмигул энергичная и милая в общении женщина в возрасте 30 лет. Она замужем. Ее муж работает заграницей. Она живет с двумя маленькими сыновьями в районе Хамадони. Им по 6 и по 3 года. Шаъмигул около 4 лет занимается продажей тканей для одежды. Ее магазин расположен рядом с ее домом. Эта деятельность ей нравится, и она старается всяческим способом угодить своим клиенткам. Сейчас у Шаъмигул маленький выбор товаров. Она запрашивает кредит, чтобы закупить новые виды тканей и материалов и увеличить свой ассортимент товара для продажи.
texts.en: Sha'migul is an energetic woman who is easy to talk to. She is 30 years old and married. Her husband works abroad. She lives with her two young sons in the Hamadoni district. They are 6 and 3 years old. For around 4 years, Sha'migul has sold fabric for clothing. Her shop is located close to her house. She likes this business and she tries her best to please her customers any way she can. Currently, Sha'migul has a small product selection. She is requesting a loan to buy new types of fabric and materials to increase her selection of retail goods.

loans.use: to buy new types of fabric and material to increase the variety of products she sells.

loans.name: Alexander Antonio

texts.es: Alexander de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus hijos,  él se dedica a la elaboración y reparación de zapatos  desde hace 7 años, posee mucha clientela por la calidad con que trabaja, la amabilidad y los buenos precios, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, Alexander esta solicitando un crédito para poder comparar todos los materiales necesarios para seguir con su trabajo como: cuero, hilos, hormas de diferentes tallas, herramientas, etc. Ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alexander, 35, lives with his wife and children in a house he owns.  He has worked manufacturing and repairing shoes for seven years.  He has a large clientele because of the quality of his work, his kindness and his good prices.  His business is located at home.

Alexander’s asking for a loan to buy all the materials like leather, thread, shoe trees in various sizes, tools, etc. needed to continue working since this is his only source of work to be able to provide better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy shoe-making supplies.

loans.name: Gladys Elisabeth

texts.es: Gladys de 34 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hijo y su madre, ella tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de granos básicos, fruta, azúcar, golosinas, etc. desde hace 15 años posee mucha clientela por la amabilidad que tiene y los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de hogar, Gladys está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería y así surtir mas su pequeño negocio y obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Gladys, 34, is a single mother living with her son and her mother in a house she owns.  She has had a small business selling basic grains, fruit, sugar, snacks, etc. for 15 years.  She has a large clientele because of her kindness and good prices.  She’s able to cover some of her household expenses with what she earns from her work.  Gladys is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise to stock her small business and earn higher profits to provide better economic stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, fruit, sugar, snacks, etc.

loans.name: Yomar

texts.es: Yomar tiene 23 años es un joven soltero y sin hijos que vive en su casa propia de madera. Hace 5 años se inició de manera independiente en el trabajo agrícola produciendo varios de los productos rentables de su zona como son el cacao, café y barbasco. Al comenzar con este oficio uso los conocimientos que aprendió desde pequeño apoyando a sus padres en las tareas propias del campo. Cuenta con 2 hectáreas de terreno en donde realiza sus labores cotidianas brindando los cuidados necesarios a sus plantaciones esperando obtener una buena calidad de frutos que posteriormente vende a los comprandores del lugar y logra recuperar el dinero que invierte en la compra de abono orgánico. Dentro de sus principales objetivos a largo plazo esta el construir su vivienda a base de material noble y formar un hogar muy sólido al igual que sus padres. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para salir adelante. En esta oportunidad desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para invertir en sus terrenos con la compra abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Yomar is 23 years old. He is single and doesn't have any children. He lives in his own home, which is made out of wood. Five years ago, he started to work as an independent farmer, growing several of the profitable crops in his area, such as cacao, coffee, and mullein. To start his business, he used the knowledge he had learned as a child helping his parents work in the fields. He has five acres of land where he works daily tending to his crops as necessary in hopes of obtaining high quality products to later sell to local buyers. This way he is able to recover what he invests in buying organic fertilizer. One of his main long-term goals is to rebuild his home using more durable materials and start a very stable family like his parents did. 

This is his first loan through Kiva and he is grateful for the financial support he is receiving in order to get ahead. This time around he wants to have 1,000 nuevos soles to invest in his land by purchasing organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is 51-year-old, married mother of nine children. Four of her children are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Rosana has a mat-weaving business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy materials needed for her mat weaving.

Rosana has been in this business for 31 years. In the future, she would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her mat weaving.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi appreciates for her previous Kiva loan, which improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.

She is requesting for a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase salt, bread, milk and other household consumables for resale. She thanks Yehu for its financial support.

loans.use: to purchase salt, bread, milk and other household consumables for resale.

loans.name: Sofya

texts.en:
Sofya is from Yerevan and studies at the Yerevan State Basic Medical College, where she specializes in nursing procedures. In addition to her studies, Sofya works at a local clinic as a recorder. The work is part-time so she is able to devote herself to her studies at the same time. 

Sofya lives with her mother and brother. Her salary helps to cover the family’s daily needs, so it is very difficult for her to save money for her education. She has therefore decided to apply for a loan. She will use her loan funds to pay her tuition fees and continue her education.
 
Getting a higher education degree is essential for Sofya in order for her to be able to work in her area of specialization. She is grateful for the support of her lenders.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition fees

loans.name: Jovencio

texts.en:
Jovencio is a motorcycle driver, the business locally known as 'habal-habal'. He lives with his family in the town of San Miguel, Bohol. Jovencio has used his motorcycle to transport passengers from one place to another.

Jovencio is asking for a loan to buy spare parts for the motorcycle, such as wheels, tires, chains, nuts, and bolts. With this loan, he will be able to maintain and improve the working condition of his motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the motorcycle, such as wheels, tires, chains, nuts, and bolts.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive con sus padres, su hermano y su hija de 4 años de edad, ella se dedica  desde hace varios años al cultivo de hortalizas ejotes, güisquiles, pipianes y ayote, su hermano le ayuda en la siembra, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela por la calidad de los productos y los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias ayuda en los gasto de su hogar, la clienta esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. para poder seguir con sus siembras ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así poder tener una mejor estabilidad económica junto con su familia.
texts.en:
This client lives with her parents, brother and 4-year-old daughter.  For several years she’s been growing green beans, chayote, squash and pumpkin.  Her brother helps her and she sells her products in various markets located near her home.  She has many customers because of the quality of her products and the good prices.  What she earns helps her pay her household expenses.

She’s asking for this loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pest control, etc. to continue with her planting since it’s her only source of work to attain better economic stability with her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente vive en casa alquilada con su esposa y su hija, el se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tostadas de plátano, chicharras y yuca desde hace 5 años, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa y también vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, el cliente esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de los ingredientes que necesita como  plátanos, yuca, chicharrón, aceite, etc. para seguir elaborando los alimentos y así obtener mejores ganancias y poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This client lives with his wife and daughter in a rented house.  He has been working making and selling fried bananas, fried pork rind and fried cassava for five years.  His business is located at home and he also sells from place to place in various neighborhoods located near his home.  He’s able to cover some of the expenses that arise at home with what he earns from his sales.

He’s asking for a loan to buy ingredients like bananas, cassava, pork, oil, etc. needed to continue making the food to earn higher profits that way and be able to give his family better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy bananas, cassava, pork, oil, etc.

loans.name: Rosas

texts.es:
Rosas tiene 34 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus cuatro hijos en la zona rural de San José a 30 minutos del Distrito de Callayuc donde su población se decía a la agricultura y ganadería en la Provincia de Cutervo que está ubicada en la Región Cajamarca en la sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica desde hace 15 años a la destilación de aguardiente, que es utilizado como una bebida alcohólica artesanal y con fines curativos y antisépticos , esta destilación es el proceso de transformación de la planta de caña de azúcar.

Rosas ha solicitado a Edpyme alternativa un préstamo de 3 500 nuevos soles para invertirlo en la compra de materia prima, la planta caña de azúcar, que le va a permitir un incremento en la destilación y de esta manera poder ofrecerlo a sus clientes generándoles mayores utilidades.
texts.en:
Rosas is 34 years old and lives with his wife and four children in the rural district of San José, which is located 30 minutes from the District of Callayuc.  The residents of this area engage in agriculture and livestock breeding.  This community lies in Cutervo Province, which is in the Cajamarca region in the highlands of northern Peru.  

Rosas has been distilling aguardiente for 15 years.  In addition to being an artisanal alcoholic beverage, aguardiente is also used in medicines and antiseptics.  Distillation is the process by which he is able to transform sugar cane into aguardiente.  

Rosas is requesting a loan from Edypyme Alternativa in the amount of 3,500 PEN so that he can invest in raw materials, sugar cane plants, in order to increase his distillation.  This will enable him to satisfy his customers and generate more profit.

loans.use: to buy sugar cane for making aguardiente.

loans.name: Reggie

texts.en:
Reggie, age 53, operates a food stall to earn an income. She is a hard worker and has been engaged in this business for 10 years.

In the Philippines, the whole working community and most families only eat home-cooked meals during the evenings, when all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a common family tradition but also a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to use cooking gas and prepare food for one or two people when buying cooked rice and viands costs less than the raw food. This is why Reggie's business has such high demand. Her regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community. She earns a minimum of PhP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, Reggie is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000. She will utilize her loan funds to buy greater quantities of such items as meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, seasonings, and frozen food products. 

Reggie dreams of expanding her business and hopes to gain a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week as well as to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, and vegetables as well as other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Batkhuyag

texts.en:
Mr. Batkhuyag, 35 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He provided taxi services to local people between 2005 and 2012. Since 2012, he has been transporting goods between districts. His elder two children go to high school, while the youngest one stays at home. 

He is requesting a loan of 2,200,000 MNT to buy grass in large amounts as food for domestic animals. He will sell the grass to local herdsmen, providing them with a necessary supply, and generating income. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy grass in large amounts to sell for feeding animals

loans.name: Pabla

texts.es:
Pabla y sus Familiares vinieron del  Interior del país de donde eran ellos originariamente.
Su Padre trabaja en Construcción de viviendas, su Hermana mayor ya se recibió de Contadora Pública y es también la que aporta para cubrir los gastos de la casa.
Pabla con su carrera quiere poder ayudar también en la casa, y así sentirse útil. Está estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería Ambiental, ya que desde niña siempre le ha gustado cuidar el medio ambiente y todo lo que con ello tiene que ver.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder pagar la defensa de su tesis, ya que esta a pasos de cumplir con su meta y quiere poder hacerlo.
texts.en:
Pabla and her family members are originally from the interior of Paraguay.  Her father works in home construction.  Her older sister received her degree in Public Accounting and is also contributing to the household expenses.  

When she earns her degree, Pabla will also be able to contribute to the household, which will make her feel useful.  She is studying for a degree in Environmental Engeering.  As a young girl, she always liked taking care of the environment and that was all she ever wanted to do.  

Pabla is requesting this loan so that she can pay for the defense of her thesis.  She is taking the steps to complete her goal, which she is determined to do.

loans.use: to pay for the defense of her thesis.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
This is Tessie, 51, a resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Joel, a tricycle driver and they have children. She and her husband manage their own household. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Tessie oversees and owns operations of their tricycle transportation business. They have one unit of tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits to Tessie a boundary (daily quota) each day. In her business, the regular customers are the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts and accessories and also pay for the maintenance of heir motorcycle. 

Tessie dreams of being more successful in her business and she hopes to give her family a good life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hija la cual asiste a una escuela cercana de la localidad, su madre y su padre. Ella posee una venta de ropa tiene de diferentes estilos y  para todas las personas damas, caballeros, niños y niñas, la ropa que comercia es de muy buena calidad y la vende a precios accesibles es por eso que se ha hecho de mucha clientela últimamente; Para la clienta el propósito y coraje que le pone a su labor tiene una dirección ver crecer el negocio para lograr un mejor futuro, es por eso que se decidió solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa en variedad como faldas, pantalones, blusas, camisetas, trajes etc. Así siempre podrá satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.  Tiene la esperanza que de esta forma lograra darle a su familia seguridad económica y una vida plena.
texts.en:
This client is a single mother living with her parents and daughter in a house she owns. Her daughter attends a nearby school.  She sells clothes.  She has various styles for women, men, girls and boys.  The clothes she sells are very good quality and she sells them at affordable prices so she’s acquired a large clientele of late.  For her, the purpose and drive she puts into her work is directed to seeing the business grow to attain a better future.

This is why she’s decided to ask INTEGRAL for a loan that will make it possible for her to buy a variety of clothes like skirts, pants, blouses, t-shirts, suits, etc. so that she will always be able to fill customer need.  Her hope is that she will provide her family with economic security and a full life this way.

loans.use: to buy assorted clothing.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman and a mother of four children who are still attending school. She lives in the town of San Miguel, Bohol with her family. 

Jocelyn is engaged in retail sales of wood and lumber. She is also engaged in a hog raising business. These are the sources of her income.

Jocelyn is asking for a loan to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed for the pigs. With this, she will be able to grow healthy pigs that she can sell after a few months. Jocelyn wants to improve her business so that it will generate more revenue necessary for the needs of the family, especially for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Sophy is 42 years old. She is widowed and resides with three children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $2 per day. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $10 daily. 

To improve her farming process, Sophy is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase cattle for tilling her farmland. This purchase will help her reduce her farming expenses. In the future, she would like to build a new house and help her youngest child earn Bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for tilling her farmland

loans.name: Palomitas Blancas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PALOMITAS BLANCAS”  iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Alicia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: hilado de lana, venta de calzados, venta de verduras, venta de medias y guantes, tejido de mantas, venta de abarrotes, venta de papa y chuño, ayudante de minibus.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Alicia es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación su amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de taxista; este negocio lo emprendió hace quince años atrás, conjuntamente su esposo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de llantas de auto) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente instalará en su automóvil. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros que se realizan en la institución.

Al grupo acompaña la Asesora, ella esta vestida con chaleco azul y rojo.
texts.en:
The “Palomitas Blancas” (Little White Doves) communal bank will start its fourth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the German Busch Focal Center.  It consists of nine members led by a governing board presided over by Alicia.  The members of the communal bank carry out a variety of activities among which are: wool weaving, shoe sales, vegetable sales, socks and gloves sales, blanket weaving, grocery sales, potato and dehydrated potato sales and minibus helper.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small micro businesswomen like Alicia.  She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer a year ago having been invited by a friend who is a member of the institution.  She currently has a taxi service, a business she started 15 years ago together with her husband.

The loan she’ll take out is to increase capital.  She will buy tires for her car from wholesalers in the city of El Alto and have them installed on her car.  This way of working makes it possible for her to support her home as possible since she’s married and has two children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the savings they make in the institution.

The group is accompanied by their consultant; she’s wearing a blue and red vest.

loans.use: to buy tires.

loans.name: Norma  Llanira

texts.es: Norma de 36 años de edad vive con esposo y sus tres  hijos en casa propia, Norma es una mujer trabajadora, responsable y muy emprendedora, desde hace 8 años se dedica a la crianza de ganado de engorde. Tiene muy buena clientela ya que ha sabido ganarse la confianza de sus clientes. Ofrece calidad y buenos precios,  ha decidido invertir en el cuidado de sus ganados ya que de eso depende su negocio. Por eso ha solicitado un crédito para poder comprar vitaminas y concentrado para el ganado y así poder seguirle dando a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitaciones algunas.
texts.en:
Norma, age 36, lives with her husband and their three children in her own house.  Norma is a hard-working, responsible, and very enterprising woman.  She has been raising and fattening livestock for eight years.  She has very good clientele because she has known how to win the confidence of her customers.  She offers quality at good prices.

She has decided to invest in the care of her livestock because that is what her business depends upon.  Therefore, she has requested a loan to be able to buy vitamins and concentrated feed for the livestock.  This way she will be able to continue giving her family a better quality of life without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and concentrated feed for the livestock.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 42 years old and married with one kid who is in school. Analiza works very hard to provide for them.

Analiza runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Analiza has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, soap, sugar, snack foods and other groceries. 

In the future, Analiza would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en:
Mlongo is a married woman with five school-going children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past five years, she has operated a kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned price fluctuation as her major challenge. Mlongo dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans, and sweets for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans, and sweets for resale.

loans.name: Sefu

texts.en:
Sefu is a tea farmer in Rwantende-Kyamuhunga, and he has done tea farming for the last 13 years. He is a married man with eight children; the youngest is four years old. 

He works five days a week, and dedicates seven hours to the farming business per day. In addition to farming, he also sells bananas from his banana plantation, and this greatly supplements his income. He started the business (tea farming) with a motive of getting money to support his family; he now hopes to use the loan funds of two million (ugx.2,000,000) to buy fertilizer to boost the fertility of the soils on the farm land so that he can increase his harvest. 

His major client is the Kyamuhunga Tea factory, and he has hopes of expanding his business. Hailstorms during the rainy season are his major challenge, since they affect the garden negatively. However, he believes that if the loan is given and he keeps the honesty he has always had, he will beat the odds and get his dream in life.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Ia

texts.en:
Ia is from the village of Akura, Kakheti Region. She is 57 years old, married, and lives with her husband. 

Ia works as a hired worker at the local farmer's vineyard, in return for a small service fee. Her earnings are seasonal and unstable. Ia's husband is a mini-bus driver and the main income provider in the household. The couple works hard to generate income and improve their standard of living, but their earnings are modest and they don't manage to save money.

With the received loan, Ia will start a confectionery shop. She is good at baking and wishes to sell her production among local people. Ia will purchase construction materials and renovate a small store, located near her house. She will also purchase raw materials and bake various kinds of cakes. 

Ia hopes her business will generate income since there is no other, similar store nearby. She hopes for your generosity.

loans.use: to start up a confectionery shop.

loans.name: Marisol Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Marisol originaria de la ciudad de León, tiene 28 años de edad y madre de tres hijos. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería y ventas de dulces tradicionales. Ella con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio logro establecer su negocio. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien le ayuda a atender la pulpería. Comercializa sus productos en su casa ya que es un lugar transitado por muchas personas, eso hace que aumenten sus ventas y demandas.
Marisol tiene un gran sueño de convertir su pulpería a una  miscelánea donde les brinde una gran variedad de productos a sus clientes. Está solicitando el financiamiento para comprar productos tales como: café, arroz, aceite, jabón, frijoles, golosinas, entre otros con el fin de aumentar su inventario y obtener mayores ingresos. Estima que el crédito será de mucha ayuda ya que mejorara su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marisol, 28, is from the city of León and is mother of three children.  She’s a merchant by profession.  She sells groceries and traditional sweets.  With much effort and sacrifice she succeeded in establishing her business.  Her husband helps her tend to the store.  She sells her goods at home since it’s very popular with passers-by which leads to higher sales and demand.

Marisol’s great dream is to turn her grocery store into a variety store offering a wide variety of goods to her customers.  She’s asking for financing to buy such things as coffee, rice, soap, oil, beans, snacks, etc. to increase inventory and earn higher income.  She figures that the loan will be of much help in that it will improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Kimchey's Group

texts.en:
Kimchey is aged 35 years old and married. She is a mother of four children, three of whom are in school while another one is too young for school. To make a living, she and her husband have been raising chickens and working for others for a fee for two years. The current business earns her about 18,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Kimchey’s group consists of two members who live in the same village in Sangke district of Battambang province. She is a second-cycle client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Kimchey will use her portion to buy chicken feed.  She hopes to fatten her chickens so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed for nourishing her chickens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James was born and grew up in Kitui, a town southeast of Nairobi, Kenya. He moved to the capitol city about 12 years ago, and has been living in the Mukuru informal settlement ever since. 

During James' stay, he has been an active member of St. Joseph's Catholic Church, where he currently is the chair of its church group. In a bid to improve sanitation at his church, James, on behalf of his church, seeks a loan to fund the purchase of one Fresh Life toilet. 

He wishes to give the church members and the residents around the church access better sanitation facilities, and hopes that better hygienic sanitation will reduce outbreaks of sanitation-related diseases.

loans.use: To purchase and run one Fresh Life toilet

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is a young man residing in the Mukuru informal settlement of Nairobi, Kenya. Due to unemployment, Martin has developed the desire to start, manage and run his own business. Despite his cool demeanor, Martin is passionate about his community; he identified a need for sanitation in his area of residence and decided to start a Fresh Life toilet franchise. 

Martin therefore seeks money to fund the purchase of two Fresh Life toilets which he will use as a business in his community. He hopes that his franchise will grow in future and create more employment opportunities for the youth in his area. Martin is happy that this investment will help ease the sanitation issues in the slums.

loans.use: To purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es: Yobana tiene 31 años , esta casada con Emiliano de 43 años y es madre de sus tres hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Cuando cumplió 18 años y gracias a  unas terrenos que heredó de sus abuelos hallo un buen sustento para el beneficio de su familia luego de casarse. Tiene casi 13 años de experiencia en el rubro donde viene realizando las diversas  tareas con el firme apoyo de su esposo quien la apoya considerablemente. Comenta que le agrada su labor puesto que es un trabajo donde es posible tener la participación integral de la familia, no obstante la temporada de lluvias es un gran inconveniente para el normal desempeño de sus labores. Con el pasar de los años ha notado que sus suelos requieren ser reforzados para optimizar su producción para el cual desea adquirir sacos con abono orgánico y obtener mazorcas de calidad. Sus planes a futuro apuntan a la apertura de un negocio consistente en una tienda de productos comestibles para así generar más ingresos paralelo a su trabajo en el campo. Este es el segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante. En esta ocasión desea contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Yobana, 31, is married to Emiliano, 43, and is mother of three children living with her in a house she owns.  When she turned 18 thanks to some land she inherited from her grandparents she found a way of supporting her family once she got married.  She’s has almost 13 years’ experience in this line of work doing various tasks with firm help from her husband who is a big help to her.

She comments that she likes her work because it’s a type of work the entire family can participate in.  However, the rainy season makes doing work normally very difficult.

As time has passed, she’s noticed that her soil needs to be strengthened to optimize production which is why she wants to acquire sacks of organic manure to insure quality cobs of corn.

Her future plans are aimed at opening a food market to generate income alongside the field work.  This is her second Kiva loan and she feels grateful for the financial support she gets to continue forward.  On this occasion she wants to have 2,000 new soles to rely on to buy organic manure.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Xiomora De Jesus

texts.es: Xiomara de Jesús es una mujer muy trabajadora y por muchos años ha sido la cabeza firme de su  hogar, a pesar de no tener un nivel educativo superior tiene la visión que a través del esfuerzo se puede llegar a obtener lo que se quiere. En la actualidad Xiomara trabaja como dependiente en una tienda que comercializa lubricantes para vehículo, su esposo trabaja como taxista en horarios inestables en la capital y juntos velan por la educación de su hija de 14 años. Solicita el crédito para instalar el piso de su casa con material de cerámica y terminar de entecharlo, para lo cual necesita comprar materiales de construcción como: zinc, perlines, arena, cemento, cerámica y otros.
texts.en:
Xiomara de Jesús is a very hardworking woman who has been firm head of household for many years.  Despite not having higher education level she’s aware that by means of effort she can obtain whatever she wants.

She currently works as a saleswoman in an auto lubricants store and her husband works as a taxi driver in the capital with flexible schedules.  Together they see to their 14-year-old daughter’s education.

She’s asking for the loan to install a tile floor at home and to finish the ceiling.  She needs to buy building materials and supplies like metal sheets, roofing purlins, sand, cement, tile and others to do so.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Sarim's Group

texts.en: Sarim, a young lady from the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, is 25 years old and a rice grower on one hectare of land.  It is the business that she has been involved with for five years. This is the second loan for Sarim with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  She has succeeded in repaying her past loan wisely and she managed to upgrade her lifestyle so it is better than before. Now, in a group of three, she is the leader. She is seeking 1,000,000 KHR while her co-borrowers are seeking 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will be spending her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her crop. She hopes that she can gain a better yield.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide for her crop

loans.name: Sophat's Group

texts.en: Sophat is 47 years old and a married mother of four children, one of whom still counts on her as this kid is still in school. She has been engaged in her current business for 10 years. With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), she is a fourth-time borrower. She has repaid her past loan completely with success and it has enabled her to improve her lifestyle so it is better than before. For this cycle, she formed a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide, and to pay labor costs. She hopes that she can gain a better yield than last year.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide and to pay labor costs

loans.name: Raquel Armando

texts.es: Don Raquel de 42 años de edad, desde hace muchos años se dedica a cultivar la tierra.  Con mucha dedicación cultiva maíz y maicillo, lo cual le permite llevar el  pan de cada día a su hogar. Se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, honrado y responsable. Habita junto a su  grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su esposa y sus cuatro hijos. Junto a su esposa trabajan muy duro para sacar adelante a su familia. Gracias a los conocimientos en la agricultura es como logra llevar el sustento a su hogar, dado que es la única forma que conoce para ganarse la vida honradamente.  Con muchos deseos de superación se acerco a esta institución para solicitar un crédito ya que la temporada para la siembra comenzó y es necesario iniciar la siembra lo antes posible. Esta es la razón por la cual solicita el crédito ya que necesita invertir en la compra de los insumos agrícolas necesarios como: semillas, abonos, insecticidas, herbicidas,  etc. para la siembra. Confía en Dios y en su trabajo que de esta forma logrará  tener una cosecha abundante la cual le permitirá acceder a una mejor calidad de vida para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Raquel, age 42, has been cultivating the land for many years.  He grows corn and sorghum with great dedication.  This allows him to bring home the daily bread.  He is known for being a hard-working, honest, and responsible man.  He lives with his family, which is comprised of his wife and their four children.  Together, he and his wife work very hard in order to get their family ahead.

It is thanks to their knowledge of agriculture that they manage to support their household.  This is the only way they know to make a living honestly.

With a lot of desire to succeed, he approached the institution to request a loan.  The season for planting started, and he needs to start planting as soon as possible.  This is the reason that he is requesting the loan.  He needs to buy the needed agricultural supplies like seeds, fertilizers, insecticides, and herbicides, etc. for the planting.  He trusts in God and in his work that this way he will manage to have an abundant harvest.  This will allow him to access a better quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, insecticides, and herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es:
Ysabel tiene 48 años, está casado con Evaristo y tiene 2 hijos que vive con ella en su casa hecha de material noble. Ysabel se dedica a la agricultura con su esposo y sus hijos en un terreno de 2 hectáreas donde tiene plantaciones de cacao, café, barbasco y palillo. Todas las mañanas se dirige a sus terrenos en donde realiza las labores cotidianas esperando obtener productos de calidad a fin de campaña, para ello cuenta con el apoyo de trabajadores que agilizan las tareas pendientes así como en la cosecha. Con el objetivo de mejorar la calidad de sus productos para aumentar su valor comercial fertiliza sus terrenos con abono orgánico.
Uno de sus principales objetivos es construir su vivienda con material noble con los ahorros que espera percibir gracias a su trabajo. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y agradece por la oportunidad que le brindan para seguir adelante. En está oportunidad desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para invertir en sus terrenos con la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Ysabel, 48, is married to Evaristo and has two children living with her in her house made of substantial materials.  Ysabel works with her husband and children in agriculture on a two-hectare parcel planted with cacao beans, coffee, evergreen bush and sorghum.  She heads out to her parcels every day to do the daily tasks hoping to get a quality crop yield at the end of the season.  To do so, she also gets help from laborers that make some tasks like harvesting easier.  Aiming at improving the quality of her products to increase their commercial value, she fertilizes her land with organic manure.

One of her main objectives is to build her house out of substantial materials using savings she expects to get thanks to her work.  This is her first Kiva loan and she’s grateful for the opportunity she’s getting to continue moving ahead.  On this occasion she hopes to have 1,000 new soles she can rely on to invest in her land with the purchase of organic manure.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.en:
Edgardo is a farmer who owns and manages well his farm lot for a living. Farming has been his family's main source of income in their village. He is married, 46 years of age and has two children who are both school age. They live in Antagan, a far yet developed village. He is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 as added capital to purchase agricultural supplies like seeds, fertilizers and pesticides. 

He usually prefers to plant rice rather than corn. He believes that it can help him better to sustain his family's basic needs. Sometimes, life is so challenging to survive. For instance, there are the unexpected calamities like typhoons that could possibly ruin their plants and properties and cause a low harvest. Edgardo shared that for him, being optimistic in life and having a strong faith in God, whatever happens, everything will be fine, .

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies like seeds, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine is from Vostan village, where she lives with her husband and two children. (Her daughter is in the photo.)
 
Narine works at a local clinic as a nurse and helps her husband with the family's costs. Narine's daughter Sonya studies at Armenian State Pedagogical University named after Kh. Abovyan. Currently, the family faces financial difficulties and Narine isn't able to cover her daughter's university tuition. So, she has applied for this loan to be able to pay for Sonya's tuition fee and give her an opportunity to continue her studies.

The loan is highly important for this family and they hope for your support.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's university tuition

loans.name: Bibisoleha

texts.ru: Бибисолеха замужняя женщина, проживает с мужем и детьми в районе Хуросон. Ей 39 лет. У нее трое сыновей в возрасте 19, 17 и 14 лет. Ее сыновья учатся. Старший сын учится во втором курсе Таджикского Национального Университета Юридического факультета. Двое младших сыновей являются школьниками. Бибисолеха работает главой дехканского хозяйства, которое занимается выращиванием хлопка, пшеницы и арбуза. Одновременно в свободное от работы времени она занимается шитьем. Муж Бибисолехи имеет высшее медицинское образование. Он в центральной больнице района работает заведующим отделения внутренних заболеваний. В данный момент Бибисолехе и ее мужу необходимо оплатить за годовой контракт обучения сына в университете. У них сейчас на руках нет такой большой суммы, поэтому Бибисолеха обратилась за кредитом. Они заботятся о том, чтобы их сыновья в будущем получили высшее образование и работали по профессии.
texts.en: Bibisoleha is married woman who lives with her husband and children in Khuroson. She is 39 years old. She has three sons aged 19, 17 and 14. Her sons study. Her eldest son is a sophomore law student at the Tajik National University. The two younger sons are students. Bibisoleha heads a collective farm which grows cotton, wheat and watermelon. Additionally, in her spare time she works as a seamstress. Bibisoleha's husband has a medical degree. He is the head of the internal medicine department in the central district hospital. Currently, Bibisoleha and her husband must pay their son's university tuition. They do not have such a large amount of money on hand, so Bibisoleha has requested a loan. It matters to them that their sons receive a higher education and are able to work within their professions.

loans.use: to pay for her son's university tuition.

loans.name: Jilma Dinora

texts.es:
Jilma Dinora es una señora de 45 años madre soltera de tres hijos dos de ellos a su cargo, habita en la comarca Los Zarzales del municipio de El Jicaral donde ha vivido toda su vida.
Estudió la carrera de Magisterio y se desempeña como maestra de primaria en la escuela de la localidad donde tiene más de veinte años de dedicarse a esta profesión.
A pesar de ganar poco ejerce su trabajo con entusiasmo y dedicación porque es lo que más le gusta hacer enseñar a leer y escribir a los niños de su pueblo que son el futuro de Nicaragua.
Doña Jilma últimamente ha estado enferma debido a los virus que dejan las lluvias para la temporada de invierno, por tal motivo se presentó a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito con el que pretende comprar medicamentos, realización de exámenes médicos.
Confía en Dios que su solicitud sea aprobada por los inversionistas de KIva que son personas de buen corazón que apoyan al más necesitado y espera mejorar su salud para seguir dando lo mejor en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Jilma Dinora, 45, is a single mother of three children two of which are still in her care.  She lives in Los Zarzales district in the municipality of El Jircal; she’s lived there her entire life.

She studied teaching and works as an elementary school teacher in the local school; she has more than 20 years’ experience in this profession.  Despite earning little, she practices it with enthusiasm and dedication because what she likes best is teaching the children in her town who are Nicaragua’s hope for the future to read and write.

Jilma has been unwell lately due to a virus that’s common during the winter rainy season which is why she came by Ceprodel to ask for a loan to buy medicine and have some medical exams done.  She trusts in God that her request will be approved by Kiva lenders who are good-hearted people that support those most in need.  She hopes her health will improve so she can continue giving her best at work.

loans.use: to buy medicine and to have some medical examinations done.

loans.name: Ra's Group

texts.en: A young married mother of two little kids residing in Battambang province, Ra is 20 years old and married. To struggle for a living, she does rice farming on eight hectares as her main source of income. Never having been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before, Ra formed a group of three to get a new loan. She and one of her co-borrowers are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each and the remaining borrower is applying for 500,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her loan to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her crop. She hopes that she can gain a better yield than last year.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide for her crop

loans.name: Steve

texts.en:
Steve is a young man who moved to the Mukuru settlement in Nairobi, Kenya in search of employment. Due to the hardships he encountered while trying to get a job, Steve developed the desire to start, manage and run his own business. He identified a need for sanitation in his community and decided to buy into a Fresh Life toilet franchise.

Steve therefore seeks a 48,000 KES loan to buy two Sanergy Fresh Life toilets, which he will use as his source of income. He hopes that his franchise will grow in the future and create more employment opportunities for other youth in his area.

Steve is happy that this investment will help ease the sanitation issues in the area. He also hopes that his success will inspire other youth to start their own ventures instead of relying on limited employment opportunities.

loans.use: To buy two Fresh Life toilets

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: Mónica tiene 35 años, está casada con Alejandro de 41 años y tiene una hija de 9 años con quien vive en su casa propia. Se dedica a la agricultura hace más de 16 años en un terreno que compró con su esposo y desarrollarlo como su principal oficio para el sustento de su pequeña familia. Posee en un total de 3 hectáreas con árboles de cacao y frutales que trabaja de manera tecnificada con el firme apoyo de su esposo. Al iniciarse en este oficio no contaba con mucho dinero para usarlo como capital por ser joven, no obstante el contar con una pareja muy dedicada al trabajo le permitió superar muchos obstáculos. Su labor de todos los días consiste en realizar trabajos de mantenimiento y cuidados a sus plantaciones de cacao siendo indispensable para que obtenga frutos de calidad en la cosecha. Es por ello que debe invertir en cada campaña en la contrata de jornaleros que le ayudan a retirara la maleza y otros de entre sus plantaciones y a la vez fertilizar sus terrenos de cultivo con guano de aves y otros abonos naturales. Uno de sus principales objetivos a largo plazo es obtener mejores ingresos para adquirir mas parcelas e incrementar su producción en beneficio de su economía familiar. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En estÁ oportunidad desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Mónica is 35 years old, is married to 41-year-old Alejandro, and has a 9-year-old daughter with whom she lives in a house she owns. She has made a living from agriculture for more than 16 years on a piece of land she bought with her husband, and this work is their primary means for sustaining their small family. She has a total of 3 hectares with cacao and fruit trees that she works in an expert manner with the solid support of her husband. When she was starting this business, she didn't have a lot of money to use as capital because she was young. However, having a very dedicated working partner to count on allowed her to overcome many obstacles.

Her daily work consists of doing maintenance work and caring for her cacao crops, as this is indispensable in ensuring that she will obtain quality fruits at the harvest. This is why she must invest in each planting, hiring day workers who help her to clear the weeds and other undergrowth from her crops, and also fertilizing the lands that she cultivates with bird droppings and other natural fertilizers. One of her primary long-term objectives is to have better earnings to acquire more parcels of land and to increase her production to benefit her family's budget.

This is her first loan with Kiva and she feels grateful for the financial support she is receiving to keep moving forward. She also commits to making her payments in a punctual manner. At this time she would like to have 1,000 Peruvian nuevos soles to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Saron's Group

texts.en: Saron is a young mother in her late 20s and is the mother of two little kids. Saron is a villager from Banteay Meanchey province who strives for a living via rice farming. To earn additional income, she also sells her handmade flat bamboo baskets. Engaging in this current business for several years, she is able to earn up to 25,300 KHR per day. This is the seventh loan for Saron and sixth loan for her co-borrower in the same group of two. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and to buy more bamboo to make the flat baskets. She hopes to gain a good yield, better than before, to keep improving her income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Angela Maria

texts.es:
Angela Maria es una joven de 24 años que nació en La Paz – Bolivia y se dedica, los fines de semana, a ayudar a su mamá en el manejo del restaurante que tienen en la ciudad de Oruro. Se graduó de la carrera de Comercio Internacional con el apoyo de su familia, pero por sobre todo de su papá, quien es chofer de transporte público, ahora, ella ha adquirido un préstamo educativo para complementar su formación universitaria estudiando una Maestría en Comercio Exterior y Logística Internacional,para poder ser más competitiva en el mercado laboral y así poder optar a mejores oportunidades laborales con los nuevos conocimientos adquiridos.
Su sueño es poder retribuir a su padre todo el esfuerzo que hizo para que ella pueda ser una profesional destacada y además obtener un empleo que le permita aportar al país con sus conocimientos y poder superarse continuamente puesto que considera que la sociedad ha caído en un conformismo que debe ser superado día a día por gente emprendedora. 
Asimismo agradece a todas las personas que le dan la oportunidad de adquirir nuevos conocimientos y le están brindando su apoyo.
texts.en:
Angela Maria is a 24-year-old young woman who was born in La Paz, Bolivia. On the weekends she works, helping her mother run the restaurant they have in the city of Oruro. She graduated with a degree in International Trade with the support of her family, but above all from her father, who is a public transportation driver. Now she got an education loan to complete her university studies with a Masters degree in International Trade and Logistics so that she can be more competitive in the job market and have options for better job opportunities with the new knowledge she has acquired.

Her dream is to be able to give back to her father with all of the effort he gave her so that she could be an important professional. She also wants employment that allows her to support the country with her knowledge and to be able to continuously get ahead. She feels that society has fallen into a conformist pattern that should be overcome each and everyday by enterprising people. 

She also want to thank all of the people who have given her the opportunity to acquire this new knowledge and for giving her their support.

loans.use: to obtain her Masters degree in International Trade and Logistics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy papayas, apples, chayote, green beans and others.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
Alfredo es un hombre casado de 45 años de edad,  padre de 5 hijos  de los cuales son, 3 hombres y 2 mujeres quienes viven en el  Departamento de Suchitepequez.
El es un hombre trabajador que desea que su familia salga adelante y tenga una mejor calidad de  vida. Actualmente presta el  servicio de mototaxi en su comunidad,  ya que es una forma que puede ayudar a sus clientes a trasportarse de un lugar a otro. Eligio esta actividad porque tiene la oportunidad de conocer otros lugares y porque obtiene ingresos y ganancias aceptables que le ayudan a cubrir  los gastos de su familia.
El ha observado que tiene una fuerte demanda en cuanto al servicio de mototaxi, por lo que ha decidido solicitar un préstamo de Q 3,500.00 para la compra de repuestos para su mototaxi y de esta manera podrá incrementar sus ganancias.
Su mayor sueño es sacar adelante a sus hijos en sus estudios para que en un futuro tengan mejores oportunidades en la vida.
texts.en:
Alfredo, 45, is married and father of five children, three boys and two girls, living in Suchitepéquez Department.  He’s a hardworking man who wants his family to get ahead and to have better quality of life.  He’s currently providing mototaxi services in his community since that’s a way he can help clients transport themselves from place to place.  He chose this line of work because it gives him the opportunity to get to know other places and because he earns acceptable income and profits that help him cover family expenses.

He’s noted heavy demand with respect to mototaxi service which is why he’s decided to request a 3,500 Quetzal loan to buy spare parts for his mototaxi to be able to increase profits.  His greatest dream is to provide schooling for his children so that in future they will have better life opportunities.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his mototaxi.

loans.name: Sophal's Group

texts.en:
A resident from a rural village in the Sangke district, Sophal is a 41-year-old father of three dependent children. The main sources of the family’s income are from raising chickens and selling recycled trash for the past two years. Sometimes his wife does paid work for others. Sophal’s current businesses earn him about 12,000 KHR a day. From this he can manage to save about 2,000 KHR each day after daily expenses.

This is the fifth loan for Sophal’s group of two members. They successfully paid back their loans with VisionFund. Now he is acting as leader of his group to apply for a 1,000,000 KHR loan. He will use his portion to buy chicken feed and more recyclables to sell.

Sophal hopes this loan will enable him to earn more income and so improve his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed and more recyclables to sell

loans.name: Sreyda's Group

texts.en: Sreyda is 21 years old and a married mother blessed with one kid. For the sake of her family, she does rice farming on two hectares, which she has been involved in for three years. It has returned her about 24,400 KHR per day.  This is a first-microloan-group consisting of three members with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She and one of her co-borrowers are seeking 500,000 KHR each and the remaining member is applying for 300,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide, and to pay plowing fees for her crop. She hopes that she can double her yield and make more income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide and to pay  plowing fees

loans.name: Chenda's Group

texts.en: Chenda is 23 years old and a married mother of two children. Her main source of income is from rice farming on three hectares of farmland with the support of her husband. Involved in her current business for 10 years, she is able to earn about 28,300 KHR per day. This is not the first loan for Chenda with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has wisely managed her past loans, which she has repaid with success to make her lifestyle better than before. For this loan, she formed a group of three to get a new loan. She and one of her co-borrowers are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each and the remaining member is applying for 600,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her crop. She hopes that she can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide for her crop

loans.name: Durmishkhan

texts.en: Durmishkhan is 28 years old and married with two children living in the village of Karajala, Kakheti Region. Durmishkhan’s mother lives with his family as well. Durmishkhan has a vocational education in welding but he doesn’t work in his profession and runs an agricultural business. He cultivates a plot of land where maize, onions and various vegetables are grown. Durmishkhan and his mother sell their harvested products as well as purchased vegetables at the neighboring town's open market. The existing funds are not enough for the family of five. In order to generate more income, Durmishkhan decided to purchase a second-hand car to use as a taxi. He will transport passengers from his district to the capital city in return for a service fee. The local people mainly use a taxi service to connect with the capital city and Durmishkhan’s service will have high demand.  A loan of $ 3000 will help him to start his taxi business. Durmishkhan is a very enthusiastic and hard working person with a great desire to ensure his children have a good education to progress in life. This loan will be a great support for the family. Durmishkhan is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to purchase a car to start a taxi business

loans.name: Yulisa

texts.es: Yulisa de 28 años, está casada con Anatolio y tiene 2 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Se dedica integralmente a las actividades productivas consistentes en el mantenimiento y producción de cacao orgánico en su localidad. Lleva casi 13 años desempeñándose de manera independiente y ha logrado hasta el momento consolidar su labor como un gran sustento para su economía familiar. Le agrada mucho su trabajo puesto que puede siempre contar con el apoyo de su esposo con quien viene realizando las tareas rutinarias de deshierbo, retiro de maleza, entre otros. Sus objetivos a largo plazo apuntan a la adquisición de más terrenos para dedicarlos a la producción de café orgánico y de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos en beneficio de su economía familiar. Este es el segundo préstamo que solicita con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está oportunidad desea contar con 2,000 nuevos para comprar abono orgánico y fortalecer sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Yulisa, 28, is married to Anatolio and has two children living with her in her own house.  She works full-time growing organic cacao beans in her community and has been working independently for almost 13 years.  To date, she’s managed to consolidate her work as a large source of support for her family’s economy.  

She enjoys her work very much because she can always count on her husband’s support with whom she does the routine chores like weeding, clearing and others.  Her long-term goal is aimed at purchasing more land to grow organic coffee thus increasing income to benefit family economy.

This is her second Kiva loan request and she feels grateful for the financial support she’s getting to continue moving forward.  She also commits to make her payments punctually.  On this occasion she’s hoping for 2,000 new soles to buy organic manure to strengthen her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Somaly

texts.en: Somaly is 30 years old. She is married and resides with her parents in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been running a hair salon for more than three years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a soldier who makes an income of $5 each day. To improve her family’s finances, Somaly is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase farmland to use for rice cultivation. This money will help her acquire the ability to run an additional business and generate more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her shop and make some improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase farmland to cultivate rice

loans.name: Elvinia Gissel

texts.es:
Elvinia Gissel es una joven de 21 años originaria de la comarca Las Mojarras una comunidad ubicada tierra adentro del municipio de El Jicaral, es soltera, estudiante de la carrera de ciencias económicas que se gana la vida laborando como maestra de primaria en el colegio de dicha localidad.
A pesar de ser joven es una muchacha bien responsable, sencilla dedicada a sus padres quienes dependen de ella.
Cursa el cuarto año de su carrera y aún con las dificultades que le toca vivir como el que tener que atravesar en una panga el inmenso río de El Tamarindo por no tener puente para poder ir a la ciudad de León a la universidad.
Se presentó por primera vez a la oficina de Ceprodel en busca de un financiamiento, ya que se dio cuenta que hay unos inversionistas llamado Kiva que apoyan a las personas de escasos recursos y tal es su caso que necesita de esta mano ayuda para pagar varios meses de la universidad con el fin de no tener atraso alguno para culminar su carrera profesional y en un futuro tener un salario mejor.
Pone las esperanzas en Dios y en estas personas de buen corazón para poder llevar a cabo su inversión.
texts.en:
Elvinia Gissel, 21, is a young woman from Las Mojarras district, a community located inland from the town of El Jicaral.  She’s single and a student majoring in Economics.  She earns a living working as an elementary school teacher in said location’s school.

Despite her young age, she’s a very responsible, unassuming young woman devoted to her parents who are dependent on her.

She’s in the fourth year of her career despite the difficulties she’s had to live through to get to the university in the city of León like having to cross the immense El Tamarindo River on a small motor boat because there’s no bridge.

She came by the Ceprodel office for the first time seeking financing because she learned that there are lenders called Kiva that support people of scarce resources.  Her case is such that she needs a helping hand to pay several months’ tuition at the university so that finishing her career won’t be delayed and she can earn higher salary in future.  She’s placed her trust in God and in these good-hearted people to be able to carry out her investment.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Maftuna

texts.en:
Maftuna, 19, is not married, has no children and lives with her parents in Tajikistan. She loves her country very much, as one can leave noise behind there and appreciate the quiet beauty of its scenery.

For the past two years Maftuna has sold food from her shop located near her house. She works around ten hours a day. She thinks her shop is doing well because she is kind and loves what she does.

Maftuna is requesting a loan of 2,500 TJS through IMON to buy more food to stock her shop. She plans to use all additional profits to improve her family’s living conditions

loans.use: to buy more food to stock her shop.

loans.name: Sengly

texts.en:
Sengly is 38 years old and married. She is blessed with two children who are in school. 

To encounter the family’s hardship, she runs a small stall selling grocery items as the main source of income. To earn additional income, she plants rubber trees.  

This is Sengly's first microloan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). For this new cycle, she will spend her loan portion to buy a rubber tree seedling for planting and to buy more grocery items for resale. She hopes this purchase will support her business and provide a good income.

loans.use: to buy a rubber tree seedling for planting.

loans.name: Maqsud

texts.ru: 34-летний Максуд работает с друзьями на маленьком цехе по выпечке национальных лепешек. Он женат, отец троих детей. Максуд в течение 7 лет вместе с тремя друзьями пекут лепешки и  продают их из окошки. Таджикские лепешки являются востребованы для народа. Потому что для таджиков их лепешки являются главным достоянием народа и ценят его безгранично. Главным блюдом во всех праздничных столах являются лепешки. Максуду в его работе нравится то, что он всегда во время спасает людей от голода. Максуд просит кредит, чтобы купить дрова и муку, чтобы быть наготове к предстоящим праздникам.
texts.en: 34-year-old Maqsud works with friends in a small bakery which bakes traditional flat bread. He is married and has three children. For the last seven years, Maqsud and three of his friends have been baking flat bread and selling it from the bakery's window. Tajik flat breads are in demand. This is a staple food for the Tajiks, and people adore them. Flat bread is the main dish at every festive table. Maqsud likes that fact that his work saves people from hunger. Maqsud is asking for a loan to buy firewood and flour in preparation for the upcoming holidays.

loans.use: to buy flour and firewood to bake flat bread.

loans.name: Nueva Kenedy  (Montecristi) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Nueva Kennedy es un grupo integrado por 11 mujeres y 1 hombre que tiempo atrás decidieron unirse para recibir estos créditos que les han ayudado mucho para mejorar su calidad de vida, ellos se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la  señora Jenny, tiene  34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 13 y 11 años, el mayor estudia en colegio y la menor en escuela. Su esposo trabaja en un torno.
Doña Jenny  es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poderle ayudar a su esposo el cual no gana mucho en su trabajo se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos y productos por catalogo de Avon, Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella trabaja de dos a tres horas al día, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual le ayuda a su marido sobretodo con los gastos de estudios de sus hijos ya que eso es lo más importante para ella.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos, perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Este es el tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son que sus hijos tengan una buena educación.
texts.en:
The “Nueva Kennedy” communal bank consists of 11 women and one man who decided some time ago to join together to receive these loans that have helped them much to improve their quality of life.  They meet every fifteen days in Montecristi Canton known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts that are known nationally and internationally; it’s where the famous straw hats come from.

One of the members of this group is Jenny, 34.  She’s married and has two children who are 13 and 11 years old.  The oldest attends secondary school and the youngest primary school.  Her husband works as a lathe operator.

Jenny is a housewife who in order to earn income of her own to help her husband who doesn’t earn much at work sells clothes, shoes and Avon and Yanbal products via catalog (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumery and women’s accessories).  Her method of sales is door-to-door and she works two to three hours daily.  She sells on credit and collects payments every 8 days.  She’s been doing this for five years and helps her husband especially with costs of her children’s education which is most important to her.

This loan is to buy clothes, shoes, perfume, creams and cosmetics.   This is her third cycle in the communal bank and she likes it because of the help the loan provide.  Her dream is that her children have a good education.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, perfume, creams and cosmetics.

loans.name: Oysha

texts.ru: Ойше 73 года. Она проживает в районе Хуросон с мужем и тремя детьми. Ойша самая опытная и самая физически активная пожилая женщина в своем селе. Ойша занимается животноводством, выращивает крупнорогатый скот у себя во дворе. Она в этом бизнесе более 35 лет. В такой нелегкой работе ей помогает сын, но за всем она следит сама. Ойша берет кредит, чтобы купить несколько голов крупного рогатого скота с целью увеличения поголовья скота и дальнейшего развития бизнеса. Ойша надеется, что это принесет ей доход, и она сможет еще больше развивать свою деятельность.
texts.en: Oyshe is 73 years old. She lives in Khuroson with her husband and three children. Oysha is the most experienced and the most physically active elderly woman in her village. Oysha works in animal husbandry raising cattle in her yard. She has been in this business for over 35 years. Her son helps her do this hard work, but she keeps a watchful eye on all of it. Oysha is taking out a loan to buy a few head of cattle in order to increase the number of livestock she has and further develop her business. Oysha hopes it will bring her income, and she will be able to further develop her business.

loans.use: buy a few head of cattle.

loans.name: Muhudin

texts.ru:
Мухидин около 7 лет работает водителем экспресс маршрутки или микроавтобуса для 7 пассажиров. Маршрут Мухидина называется Т-67. Мухидин 42-летний женатый человек, имеет четверых детей. Его жена дома занимается шитьем женских платьев. Дети двое учатся в школе, а двое еще маленькие. 
Мухидин берет кредит, чтобы отремонтировать и декорировать свой микроавтобус. Таким путем он добивается внимания пассажиров и привлечения их. Мухидин часть денег потратит на салон машины, чтобы его клиентам было удобно ездить. Таких водителей микроавтобусов, которые думают об удобстве своих пассажиров очень мало. Надеемся таких как Мухиддин заботливых водителей будет по городу больше.
texts.en:
For about seven years, Muhidin has been driving a seven-person van on a bus route. Muhidin's route is called T-67. Muhidin is a 42-year-old married man with four children. His wife works from home sewing women's dresses. Two of the children are in school, and two are still small. 

Muhidin is taking out a loan to repair and renovate his vehicle. This way, he will attract passengers and get their attention. Muhidin will spend some of the money renovating the interior of the car so it will be comfortable for his customers. Very few minibus drivers think about the convenience of their passengers. It is to be hoped that the city will have caring drivers like Muhidin.

loans.use: repair his van so that customers will have a comfortable ride.

loans.name: Flor Daisy

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Parque A La Madre se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Flor, tiene 63 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 3 hijos  mayores de edad, el menor de ellos aun vive en su casa. El esposo es chofer. Ella aprendió corte y confección en una academia de la localidad hace muchos años atrás.
Doña Flor tiene un pequeño taller de costura y bazar en su casa, allí se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa, ella trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares que llegan hasta su taller para que les confeccione sus prendas, además de trabajar bajo pedido ella también elabora vestidos de niñas las misma que las pone en sus vitrinas y las vende cuando alguien los necesite, ella vende sus productos de bazar y confecciona sus prendas a la mismo tiempo. Lleva más de 12 años con su negocio y le va muy bien. Con esto ella ayudo y sigue ayudando a su familia a salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar telas, materiales para la costura y artículos de bazar. Esta casi desde el inicio  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir adelante y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The “Parque a la Madre” (To the Mother Park) communal bank meets every fifteen days in Jipijapa Canton, a canton known as the “Sultana of Coffee” because of the extensive plantations of uniquely flavored coffee there, for its cuisine and for the warmth of its people.

Flor, 63, lives here.  She’s in a common law relationship and has three adult children.  The youngest of them still lives at home.  Her husband’s a driver.  She learned dressmaking and design at a local academy many years ago.

Flor has a small sewing workshop and general store at home.  She makes all types of clothes there and works to order for individuals who come to her workshop to have their clothes made.  In addition to working to order, she also makes clothes for girls that she puts in her display cases and sells when someone needs them.  She sells her store goods and her clothes at the same time.  She’s been in business 12 years and does very well.  She’s helped her family to get ahead this way and is still helping them.

This loan is to buy fabric, sewing supplies and store goods.  She’s been in the communal bank almost from the beginning and she likes it because of the help she gets from the loans.  Her dream is to continue moving forward and to be in good health.

loans.use: to buy fabric, sewing supplies and store stock merchandise.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita is a 41-year-old woman from the town of Jagna, Bohol. She is married with 4 children, ages 21,19,12 and 4 year old respectively. She engages in farming. She grows and sells beans to help augment the income of her household. Her business started more than 10 years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers, seeds (beans) and a sprayer.

In the future, Lucita would like to expand her farming business and increase her business profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds (beans) and a sprayer.

loans.name: Kelly Deysi

texts.es:
Kelly tiene 24 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Imperial y para poder tener ingresos para poder solventar los gastos de su familia, sobre todo porque tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad; Kelly  trabaja en un wawawasi, el cual en una especie de guardería, en la cual cuida a niños de 1 mes hasta 3 años aproximadamente, Kelly trabaja alrededor de 9 horas, y ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque tiene mucho cariño por los niños y sobre todo tiene paciencia.

Kelly esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar materiales de construcción para poder realizar mejoras en su vivienda, de esta manera poder mejorar su calidad de vida y poder luchar por hacer realidad su sueño:” Estudiar una carrera profesional y poder darle una profesión a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Kelly, 24, lives in the city of Imperial and in order to earn her own money to be able to cover family expenses, above all because she has a two-year-old son, Kelly works in a ‘wawawasi’, which is a type of child care center where she cares for children from one month to three years of age approximately.  Kelly works about nine hours daily and believes she does well in her work because she has much affection for the children and above all is very patient.
